cancello: <entryFree id="n6448" type="main" key="cancello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancello</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cancelli</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n6448.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make like a lattice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lattice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum, i. e. with vines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancellata cutis (elephanti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cancelli: cancellato bracchiorum implexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 164</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6448.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in the Lat. of the jurists, <hi rend="ital">to strike out a writing lattice-wise</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*x</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cross out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cancel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chirographum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae cautionesque cancellatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:84" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:47:section=2" default="NO">2, 14, 47, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:15:section=1" default="NO">29, 1, 15, § 1</bibl>; Cod. 6, 33, 3. <cb n="CAND" /></sense></entryFree>
cancellosus: <entryFree id="n6449" type="main" key="cancello_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancellōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cancelli</etym>, <sense id="n6449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with bars</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a railing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cancellus: <entryFree id="n6450" type="main" key="cancellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. cancelli.</entryFree>
cancer: <entryFree id="n6451" type="main" key="cancer1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancer</orth>, <itype>cri</itype> (<sense id="n6451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> canceris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 616</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 30</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> canceres, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 3</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> Claudius, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 697</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 206" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 206</bibl> and 240) [cf. <foreign lang="greek">karki/nos</foreign>; root kar-, to be hard; whence <foreign lang="greek">ka/ruon</foreign>, cornu], <hi rend="ital">a crab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a river-crab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-crab.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6451.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:180" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 10, 58, § 180</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 369</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancer femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 7</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n6451.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hands that cling fast like the claws of crabs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orci cancri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6451.3" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Crab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sign of the zodiac in which the sun is found at the time of the summer solstice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 616</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:727" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 727</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 259</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:23" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; acc. to the fable, <hi rend="ital">as an animal hostile to Hercules in the contest with the Lernœan hydra;</hi> cf. Hyg. l. l. Hence, Lernaeus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:313" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 313</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6451.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">the region of the south</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the south</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 625</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6451.5" n="C" level="2"> To designate <hi rend="ital">great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violent heat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 127</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6451.6" n="III" level="1"> In medicine, <hi rend="ital">a crawling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppurating ulcer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">malignant tumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum immedicabile cancer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 825</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 3</bibl>; Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 697</bibl> P</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6452" type="gloss" key="cancer2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancer</orth>, <itype>cri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root kar-, to bend, twist; whence corona, circus</etym>, <sense id="n6452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lattice</hi>, the radical form of cancelli, q. v., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Orci cancros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cancerasco: <entryFree id="n6453" type="main" key="cance^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancĕrasco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n6453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [cancer, III.], <hi rend="ital">to become cancerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be afflicted with a cancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suppurate like a cancer</hi> (post-class.; only in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Horb. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cancĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">cancerous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canceraticus: <entryFree id="n6454" type="hapax" key="cance^ra_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancĕrātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canceratus, v. cancero</etym>, <sense id="n6454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a cancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancerous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foetor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 43, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canceroma: <entryFree id="n6455" type="greek" key="cance^ro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancĕrōma</orth> (contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cancrōma</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avarit. 1, p. 232</bibl>, and corrupted <orth extent="full" lang="la">canchrēma</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 22, 15</bibl>), <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karki/nwma</foreign>, <sense id="n6455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cancer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candace: <entryFree id="n6456" type="main" key="Canda^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Candăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a queen of Meroë</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 186</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> is, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 8, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candacus: <entryFree id="n6457" type="spur" key="candacus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candacus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">caudacus</orth>,) a false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 107</bibl> Müll. ad h. l.</entryFree>
candavia: <entryFree id="n6458" type="main" key="Canda_vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Candāvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kandaoui/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountainous district in Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 23, 26, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 331</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candefacio: <entryFree id="n6459" type="main" key="cande^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>candeo</etym>. <sense id="n6459.0" n="I" level="1"> (Cf. candeo. I., and candidus.) <hi rend="ital">To make dazzlingly white</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and jestingly: ebur atramento candefacere, of an impossibility,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. atramentum.—</sense><sense id="n6459.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make glowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make red hot</hi> (very rare, not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae candefieri non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 20, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides candefactos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:123" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 10, 76, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candefio: <entryFree id="n6460" type="main" key="cande^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĕfīo</orth>, v. cande-facio, II.</entryFree>
candela: <entryFree id="n6461" type="main" key="cande_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>candeo; Fr. chandelle, Engl. candle; hence</etym>, <sense id="n6461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a light made of wax</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wax-light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tallow-candle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taper.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6461.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 727</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a light of the poor, diff. from lucerna, used by the rich,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:43" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 43</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:287" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla lucernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:40" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 40</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of peeled rushes, used in funeral processions,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 70, § 178</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:103" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6461.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6461.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelam apponere valvis,</quote> <trans><tr>to set fire to the doors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 98</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 146</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n6461.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cord covered with wax</hi> (which preserved it from decay): <cit><quote lang="la">in alterā (arcā) duo fasces candelis involuti septenos habuere libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. Hem. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 86</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">used in cleansing and polishing,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candelabrarius: <entryFree id="n6462" type="main" key="cande_la_bra_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candēlābrārius</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>candelabrum</etym>, <sense id="n6462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of candlesticks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chandeliers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candelabrum: <entryFree id="n6463" type="main" key="cande_la_brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candēlābrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">can-dēlāber</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, like arater for aratrum, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 36</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">candēlābrus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75</bibl>. <pb n="277" /> <cb n="CAND" /> 10.—<sense id="n6463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabrum ardentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Com. Fragm. 111" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> Com. Fragm. 111</bibl></cit>, ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 202, 16</bibl>) [candela]: in quo figunt candelam candelabrum appellant, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 225</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 119</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> ib.; <hi rend="ital">a candleslick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a branched candlestick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chandelier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">candelabrum</hi>, or also <hi rend="ital">lamp-stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light-stand</hi>, sometimes of exquisite workmanship, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 183</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 26, § 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 28</bibl>, §§ 64 and 65; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 6, § 11 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 727</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:43" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candelifera: <entryFree id="n6464" type="main" key="Cande_li^fe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Candēlĭfĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>candela- fero</etym>, <sense id="n6464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Taper-bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a goddess supposed to assist at childbirth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for whom a symbolical candle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">torch was lighted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candens: <entryFree id="n6465" type="main" key="candens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. candeo.</entryFree>
candentia: <entryFree id="n6466" type="hapax" key="candentia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candentia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>candens</etym>, <sense id="n6466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear lustre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whiteness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
candeo: <entryFree id="n6467" type="main" key="candeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candeo</orth>, <itype>ui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr candami, to be light; candra, the moon; connected with caneo as ardeo with areo</etym>, <sense id="n6467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be brilliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glisten</hi> (cf. candidus and albus; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n6467.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6467.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Verb finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candet ebur soliis collucent pocula mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi canderet vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum turba crasso lumine candet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 753</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6467.3" n="B" level="2"> <mood>Part.</mood> and <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">candens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, = candidus, <hi rend="ital">shining. dazzling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candens lacteus umor,</quote> <trans><tr>the bright</tr>, <tr>milky fluid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucidus aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:65" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candentior Phoebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:481" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 481</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus candentissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6467.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., = albus, <hi rend="ital">white</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut candens videatur et album,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cygnus candenti corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candenti elephanto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ivory</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 895</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candida de nigris et de candentibus atra facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:315" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 315</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n6467.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi> with heat, <hi rend="ital">be glowing hot</hi> (sometimes also in prose). </sense><sense id="n6467.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Verb finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccis aër fervoribus ustus Canduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6467.7" n="B" level="2"> <mood>Part.</mood> and <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut calidis candens ferrum e fornacibus olim Stridit,</quote> <trans><tr>as the glowing iron taken from the hot furnace hisses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 148</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 170</bibl>: candenti ferro, Varr. R. R. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 100</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius candente carbone sibi adurebat capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candentes laminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl></cit> (al. ardentes); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua candens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit> (while <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 17, 14</bibl>, calens aqua). —</sense><sense id="n6467.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">glowing with passion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excited</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum viscera felle canduerint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam Stilicho sic canduit ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 82</bibl></cit> (both of these examples are by some referred to candesco).</sense></entryFree>
candesco: <entryFree id="n6468" type="main" key="candesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candesco</orth>, <itype>ui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n6468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [candeo], <hi rend="ital">to become of a bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to glisten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">radiate</hi> (rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut solet aër candescere solis ab ortu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:43" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6468.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To begin to glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow red hot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum candescit in igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 491</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin;</hi> cf. candeo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
candetum: <entryFree id="n6469" type="foreign" key="cande_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, a Gallic word signifying <sense id="n6469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a space of</hi> 100 or 150 <hi rend="ital">square feet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl>; cf. Auct. Limit. p. 292 Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 15, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candicantia: <entryFree id="n6470" type="spur" key="candicantia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candicantia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, a false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 200</bibl>; v. Sillig ad h. l.</entryFree>
candico: <entryFree id="n6471" type="main" key="candi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>candeo, like albico, from albeo</etym>, <sense id="n6471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be whitish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">white</hi> (first used by Plin. the elder), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:127" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 12, 32, § 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 237" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 237</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, § 728</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candicans vadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardamomum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 13, 29, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nube candicante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 82, § 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ficticiis (geminis) scariphatio omnis candicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 200</bibl></cit> Jan. dub.; cf. Sillig ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
candidarius: <entryFree id="n6472" type="gloss" key="candi^da_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdārius</orth> <itype>pistor</itype>, <sense id="n6472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a baker of white bread</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 304, 3</bibl> [candidus].</sense></entryFree>
candidatorius: <entryFree id="n6473" type="hapax" key="candi^da_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>candidatus</etym>, <sense id="n6473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a candidate for office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
candidatus: <entryFree id="n6474" type="main" key="candi^da_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>candidus, <cb n="CAND" /> like albatus, atratus, from albus, ater</etym>. <sense id="n6474.0" n="I" level="1"> In <pos>adj.</pos> uses, </sense><sense id="n6474.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">clothed in white</hi> (only in Plaut. and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">Cic., Hor., and Plin. use albatus): aequius vos erat Candidatas venire hostiatasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mastigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 67.—</sense><sense id="n6474.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">farinulentā cinere sordide candidati homunculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. candido.— </sense><sense id="n6474.3" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6474.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdātus</orth>. <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a candidate for office</hi>, because clothed in <hi rend="ital">a glittering white</hi> toga; cf. Dict. of Antiq. (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n6474.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorius,</quote> <trans><tr>a candidate for the prœtorship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14</bibl></cit> (15), 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:95" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 95 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedilitatis ac mox praeturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summae equestris gradus, i. e. praefecturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:28:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 28, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">From their obsequious demeanor towards the electors, called officiosissima natio candidatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbitati irasci candidatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedilitas alicui candidato data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidatus Caesaris,</quote> <trans><tr>a candidate especially recommended by Cœsar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl>.—Hence prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">petis tamquam Caesaris candidatus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>certain of the result</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 62</bibl></cit>.—In the time of the emperors: <cit><quote lang="la">candidati Principis,</quote> <trans><tr>quœstors appointed by the emperor himself to read his speeches and rescripts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 80</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6474.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">he who strives after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aims at a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a candidate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a claimant of</hi> something (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">candidatus non consulatus tantum, sed immortalitatis et gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:63:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 63, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majus est opus atque praestantius, ad quod ipse (sc. orator) tendit, et cujus est velut candidatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticae eloquentiae, id. prooem. § 13: crucis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>soon to suffer crucifixion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:41" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6474.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who seeks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solicits an office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a candidate</hi> (rare and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 252" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 252 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6475" type="main" key="candi^da_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a candidacy</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 4, 21, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
candide: <entryFree id="n6476" type="main" key="candi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. candidus <sense id="n6476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
candido: <entryFree id="n6477" type="main" key="candi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>candidus</etym>, <sense id="n6477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make glittering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make white</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albis vestibus candidari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 168" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 168</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">brilliantly white</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 14, 8, 21</bibl>; cf. 1. candidatus, I. A.</sense></entryFree>
candidule: <entryFree id="n6478" type="main" key="candi^du^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. candidulus.</entryFree>
candidulus: <entryFree id="n6479" type="main" key="candi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n6479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj dim.</hi> [candidus], <hi rend="ital">shining white'</hi> dentes, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 157</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdŭlē</orth>, in trop. signif. (cf. candidus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">candidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincerely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candidus: <entryFree id="n6480" type="main" key="candi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>candeo</etym>, <sense id="n6480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dazzling white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi> (opp. niger, a glistening black; while albus is a lustreless white, opp. ater, a lustreless black; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 82</bibl>; ls<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Orig. 12, 1, 51</bibl>; Doed. Syn. III. p. 193 sq.) (class., and in the poets very freq.; in Cic. rare). </sense><sense id="n6480.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6480.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n6480.3" n="1" level="3"> Of shining objects, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella splendens candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux clara et candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">clarā loco luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 777</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color candidus Saturni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 18, 16, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:247" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus (the constellation),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:142" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 142</bibl></cit>: aqua, Mart, 6, 42, 19: lacte, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 483, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 169, 14.—</sense><sense id="n6480.4" n="2" level="3"> Hence, an epithet of the gods or persons transformed to gods: <cit><quote lang="la">Cupido,</quote> <trans><tr>radiant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bassareus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 11</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 31</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Daphnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 56</bibl></cit> Wagn.—</sense><sense id="n6480.5" n="3" level="3"> Of birds, animals, etc., <hi rend="ital">white</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the stork</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 320</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales, i. e. cygnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidior cygnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.6" n="4" level="3"> Of the dazzling whiteness of snow: <cit><quote lang="la">altā nive candidum Soracte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 250</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 373</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.7" n="5" level="3"> Of resplendent beauty of person, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 138</bibl></cit> <cb n="CAND" /> Serv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 5, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidus et pulcher puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:27" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lampetie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:607" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 78, 80, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 16, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 17, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:861" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 861</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:68" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 1</bibl></cit> (cf. candidulus) al.—</sense><sense id="n6480.8" n="6" level="3"> Of the hair, <hi rend="ital">hoary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">white</hi> (more <usg type="style">poet.</usg> than canus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidior barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:60" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inducto candida barba gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.9" n="7" level="3"> Of trees or plants: pōpulus, <hi rend="ital">the white</hi> or <hi rend="ital">silver poplar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 708</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 355</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium nivei ligustri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:789" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 26</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6480.10" n="8" level="3"> Of textile fabrics, sails, dress, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: toga, made brilliant by fulling (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 25, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. candidatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 34, 34, § 120</bibl></cit>; cf. Titinn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 536, 23</bibl>.—So Cicero's oration: In Toga Candida, v. the fragments B. and K. vol. xi. p. 20-25; and the commentary of Asconius, Orell. vol. v. 2, p. 82 sq.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidissimus color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 17</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n6480.11" n="B" level="2"> Opp. niger, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 733</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 387</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 10, 42, § 92</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">candida de nigris et de candentibus atra facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make black white</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 315</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to some: nigrum in candida vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.12" n="C" level="2"> In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut candido candidius non est adversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 35</bibl></cit>; and with a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidum ovi,</quote> <trans><tr>the white of an egg</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 40</bibl></cit> (twice); cf.: album ovi, under album.—* </sense><sense id="n6480.13" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and causative, of the winds, <hi rend="ital">making clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloud-dis-pelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purifying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Favonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6480.14" n="E" level="2"> Also <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for candidatus (= albatus), <hi rend="ital">clothed in white</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:654" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 654</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 906</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma, i. e. Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:65:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 65, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.15" n="F" level="1"> Candida sententia = candidi lapilli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 47</bibl>; v. the pass. in connection, and cf. albus, and calculus, II. D.—</sense><sense id="n6480.16" n="G" level="1"> Candidus calculus, v. calculus, II. E.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a game</hi> or <hi rend="ital">play exhibited by a candidate for office</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">edere candidam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.17" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spotless</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n6480.18" n="A" level="2"> Of the voice, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silver-toned</hi> (opp. fuscus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 16, § 58</bibl>; perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl> (B. and K. with MSS. canorum; cf. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N cr.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n6480.19" n="B" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspicuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaffected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elaborant alii in puro et quasi quodam candido genere dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>. candidum et lene et speciosum dicendi genus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 1</bibl>.—And meton. of the orator himself: <cit><quote lang="la">Messala nitidus et candidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:113" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis et candidus et fusus Herodotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidissimum quemque et maxime expositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.20" n="C" level="2"> Of purity of mind, character (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <hi rend="ital">unblemished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guileless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">candid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit> (integer, verax, purus, sine fuco, sine fallaciā, Schol. Crucq.): <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Furnius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectore candidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet avunculum quo nihil verius, nihil simplicius, nihil candidius novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:116:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 116, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidissimus omnium magnorum ingeniorum aestimator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 129, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.21" n="D" level="2"> Of conditions of life, <hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <trans><tr>joyful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 71: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 15, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">omina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 67: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 34</bibl>: dies. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭdē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n6480.22" n="1" level="3"> Acc. to I., <hi rend="ital">in dazzling white'</hi> vestitus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.23" n="2" level="3"> Acc. to II., <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">candidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincerely</hi>: candide et simpliciter, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 107, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6480.24" n="III" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">adj. propr</hi>: Candidum Promontorium, <hi rend="ital">in Zeugitana</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">C. Bianco</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
candifico: <entryFree id="n6481" type="hapax" key="candi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>candeo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n6481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make dazzlingly white</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 7.</sense></entryFree>
candificus: <entryFree id="n6482" type="hapax" key="candi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>candifico</etym>, <sense id="n6482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes dazzlingly white</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvisculus,</quote> <trans><tr>tooth-powder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 277</bibl></cit>. <pb n="278" /> <cb n="CANE" /></sense></entryFree>
candor: <entryFree id="n6483" type="main" key="candor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>candeo, as algor from algeo, etc.</etym>. <sense id="n6483.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dazzling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glossy whiteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clear lustre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">radiance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aetherius sol irrigat adsidue caelum candore recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 283</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:232" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 232</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 322</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis candor illustrior est quam ullius ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacteus hic nimio fulgons candore notatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 249</bibl></cit> (493): <cit><quote lang="la">splendidissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">candore notabilis ipso (via lactea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi Qui candore nives anteirent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi candore eximio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">niveus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 423</bibl></cit>; and so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> of the snow: solis aestu candor quom liquesceret, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 334, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplex lanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candore tunicarum fulgens acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 39, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites candidā veste et paribus candore armis insignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 40, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6483.1" n="2" level="3"> Of resplendent beauty of person, <hi rend="ital">fairness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusus ille et candore mixtus rubor (in Venere Coa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 491</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 594</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candor hujus te et proceritas, voltus oculique pepulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO">2</bibl> (3), 25, 41; 3 (4), 24, 8 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 54, § 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 65, § 134</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulnarum nivei marmoreique candores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6483.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6483.3" n="1" level="3"> Of discourse. </sense><sense id="n6483.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Brilliancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fucatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6483.5" n="b" level="4"> In opp. to an artificial manner, affectation (cf. candidus, II. B.), <hi rend="ital">simplicity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">naturalness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Livius, in narrando mirae jucunditatis clarissimique candoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 101</bibl></cit> Frotsch.; cf. Spald. ad 2, 5, 19.—</sense><sense id="n6483.6" n="2" level="3"> Of mind or character, <hi rend="ital">candor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincerity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">openness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frankness</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Si vestrum merui candore favorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; 2, 467; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justus sine mendacio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:116:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 116, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua simplicitas, tua veritas, tuus candor!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:84" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6483.7" n="II" level="1"> (After candeo, II.) <hi rend="ital">Glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aestivus, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olyb. 219: flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:35" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
candosoccus: <entryFree id="n6484" type="foreign" key="candosoccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">candosoccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gallic</etym>; in husbandry, <sense id="n6484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a layer of a plant;</hi> pure Lat. mergus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canens: <entryFree id="n6485" type="main" key="ca_nens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. caneo <sense id="n6485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n6486" type="main" key="ca^nens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. cano.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6487" type="main" key="Ca^nens3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Janus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Picus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:333 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 333 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
canentas: <entryFree id="n6488" type="gloss" key="canentas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canentas</orth> (Cod. Mon. <orth extent="full" lang="la">canentes</orth>), <sense id="n6488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ornament for the head</hi>, Paul ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
caneo: <entryFree id="n6489" type="main" key="ca_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>canus</etym>, <sense id="n6489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be gray</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be white</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose); <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cānens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">gray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grayish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">white</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus geminis canebat sparsa senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 416</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canens senecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canet in igne cinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canens gelu,</quote> <trans><tr>white</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:206" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 206</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">pruina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:534" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canentia lilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum gramina canent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 325</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canuerint herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:880" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 880</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:144" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 110</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:456" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 456</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:357" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 357</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:362" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 362</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canephoros: <entryFree id="n6490" type="greek" key="Ca^ne_pho^ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănēphŏrŏs</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-phŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 70</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kanhfo/ros, h(</foreign> (she that bears a basket, v. <foreign lang="greek">kanhfo/ros</foreign>, and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:711 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 711 sq.</bibl>), <sense id="n6490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">paintings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">statues of Greek artists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">representing Athenian maidens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the festivals of Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Minerva</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ceres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bore different sacred utensils in wicker baskets</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">ka/nh</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">on their heads; nom. sing.</hi> Canephoros (a work of Scopas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 25</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Nom. plur.</hi> Canephoroe = <foreign lang="greek">kanhfo/roi</foreign> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Adelphoe, arctoe, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Acc. plur.</hi> Canephoros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 8, § 18</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 70</bibl>.—A collat. Latinized form, Canifera, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
canes: <entryFree id="n6491" type="main" key="ca^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. canis.</entryFree>
canesco: <entryFree id="n6492" type="main" key="ca_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānesco</orth>. ĕre, <sense id="n6492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [caneo]. <hi rend="ital">to grow white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whiten.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6492.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become gray</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula canescunt (sc. calore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 212</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canescant aequora remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canescunt tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli canescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 46, § 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 23</bibl>: in cujus (Minervae) aede ignes numquam canescunt<cb n="CANI" />  in favillas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6492.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = senescere, <hi rend="ital">to grow old</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 422</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eaque (quercus) canescet saeclis innumerabilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsa oratio jam nostra canesceret,</quote> <trans><tr>was getting feeble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cangi: <entryFree id="n6493" type="main" key="Cangi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cangi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kagganoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n6493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the western part of Britain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cania: <entryFree id="n6494" type="main" key="cani^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wild nettle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 55, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canicae: <entryFree id="n6495" type="main" key="cani^cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canĭcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bran</hi>: canicae furfures de farre a cibo canum vocatae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll.; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 88, 16 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
canicula: <entryFree id="n6496" type="main" key="ca^ni_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>canis</etym>. <sense id="n6496.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small dog or bitch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 79</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6496.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a passionate, quarrelsome woman, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6496.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6496.3" n="A" level="2"> Canis Minor, <hi rend="ital">the lesser dogstar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the mouth of the constellation</hi> Canis, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:268" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 28, 68, § 268</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caniculae aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of Diogenes: <cit><quote lang="la">illa canicula Diogenes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv.
