Marc. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. capella.—</sense><sense id="n6496.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sea-dog</hi> (cf. canis, II. B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:151 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 46, 70, § 151 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6496.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The worst throw with dice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the dog throw;</hi> opp. to Venus (v. canis, II. C., and alea), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:49" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canicularis: <entryFree id="n6497" type="main" key="ca^ni_cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănīcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canicula, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n6497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the dog-star</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>dog-days</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jul. 1</bibl></cit> and 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> Veg. 5, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclementia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canidia: <entryFree id="n6498" type="main" key="Ca_ni^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cānĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sorceress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often mentioned by Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 95</bibl>; to whom Epod. 5 and 17 are addressed.</sense></entryFree>
canidius: <entryFree id="n6499" type="main" key="Cani^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Canĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name;</hi> esp., P. Canidius Crassus, <hi rend="ital">a general under Lepidus and Antony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to death by Octavius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 85, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:87:3" default="NO">2, 87, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canifera: <entryFree id="n6500" type="gloss" key="ca_ni^fe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānĭfĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: mulier, quae fert canuam, id est qualum, quod est cistae genus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65</bibl> Müll.; v. Canephoros.</entryFree>
caniformis: <entryFree id="n6501" type="hapax" key="ca^ni^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canis-forma</etym>, <sense id="n6501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the form of a dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dog-shaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anubis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 263</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caninefates: <entryFree id="n6502" type="main" key="Canine^fa_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caninĕfātes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cannin-</orth>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people dwelling upon the Batavian peninsula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:105" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 56</bibl>; 4, 79; 4, 85; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cannĕnĕfātes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 15, 29, § 101</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cannunĕfā-tes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 96</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux natione Caninefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6502.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caninĕfas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Caninefas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 19</bibl></cit> al.</sense></entryFree>
caninius: <entryFree id="n6503" type="main" key="Ca^ni_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n6503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a plebeian</hi> gens <hi rend="ital">at Rome.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6503.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Caninius Rebilus, <hi rend="ital">lieutenant of Cœ sar in Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consul for a few hours at the end of December</hi>, A. U. C. 709; <cit><quote lang="la">hence the jest of Cicero: Caninio consule scito neminem prandisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 37, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6503.2" n="II" level="1"> Caninius Rebilus, <hi rend="ital">perh. a son of the preceding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notorious for his abandoned life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:21:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 21, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6503.3" n="III" level="1"> L. Caninius Gallus, <hi rend="ital">accuser of Antony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards his son-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 3</bibl>; 7, 1, 4; 9, 2, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 2, 6</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Caninius Gallus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <trans><tr>the time when Caninius proposed that Pompey should restore the dethroned king Ptolemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit> Manut.</sense></entryFree>
caninus: <entryFree id="n6504" type="main" key="ca^ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canis</etym>, <sense id="n6504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dog-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6504.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:227" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 161" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">far,</quote> <trans><tr>spelt-bread for dogs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 35, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>eye-teeth</tr>, <tr>dog-teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaeva canina,</quote> <trans><tr>a favorable augury taken from meeting a dog or from his barking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6504.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">canīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caro), <hi rend="ital">dog</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s flesh</hi>: canis caninam non ēst, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 32</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n6504.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: prandium, <hi rend="ital">in which no wine is drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 12 sq.</bibl> (v. the connection, and cf. with our <hi rend="ital">dog-cheap</hi>): littera, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the letter</hi> R, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:109" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 109</bibl>: facundia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">abusive from its snarling sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snarling</hi>, Appius ap. Sall. H Fragm. <cb n="CANI" /> 2, 37 Dietsch (from <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 60, 24</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">eloquen tia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18, 26</bibl>; cf. Spald. Quint. l. l.: caninum studium locupletissimum quemque adlatrandi, i. e. causidicorum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">9: verba,</quote> <trans><tr>cutting words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:230" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 230</bibl></cit>: nuptiae, <hi rend="ital">canine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beastly</hi> (cf.: canis obscena; <cit><quote lang="la">v. canis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 69</bibl></cit>, n. 2: philosophi = Cynici, Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 20; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, caninae aequanimitatis stupor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canipa: <entryFree id="n6505" type="gloss" key="ca_ni^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānĭpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = canistrum, <sense id="n6505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fruitbasket for religious uses</hi>, Frat. Arv. Marin. 3.</sense></entryFree>
canis: <entryFree id="n6506" type="main" key="ca^nis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cănes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 135</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 32</bibl> Müll., or Ann. v. 518 Vahl.; Lucil. ap. Varr. ib.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, 17, p. 118</bibl> P.; <case>abl.</case> always cane; <sense id="n6506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> canum; v. Neue, Formenl. pp. 223, 258 sq.), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. cvan; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ku/wn, kuno/s</foreign>; Germ. Hund; Engl. hound</etym>. </sense><sense id="n6506.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dog.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6506.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:9:1" default="NO">2, 9, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 142</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl>: tantidem quasi feta canes sine dentibus latrat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 32</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 518 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">introiit in aedĭs ater alienus canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: inritata canes, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, p. 100</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">canem inritatam imitarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Hyrcaniă plebs publicos alit canes, optumates domesticos: nobile autem genus canum illud scimus esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lupi canibus similes sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes ut montivagae persaepe ferai Naribus inveniunt quietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acriores et vigilantiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> R. R. 7, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:37:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenă vinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Molossi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1063" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1063</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 470</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:936" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 936</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastoralis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulicosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:13:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 892</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 932" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 932</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 32, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva canum rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit> (4, 15), 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 63, § 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est verunculus in linguă canum, quo exempto nec rabidi fuint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 32, § 100</bibl></cit>: rabiosa. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 13, § 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alere canes ad venandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum fida custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fida canum vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levisomna canum fido cum pectore corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 864</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput mediae canis praecisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 9, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe citos egi per juga longa canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canibus circumdare saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos non inmissis canibus agitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leporem canibus venari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 410</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6506.4" n="1" level="3"> As a term of reproach, to denote, </sense><sense id="n6506.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A shameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 33</bibl> Donat. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6506.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A fierce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enraged person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:14:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 14, 5, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 3" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 22:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 22, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.7" n="2" level="3"> As the regular designation of the hangers-on or parasites of an eminent or rich Roman; <hi rend="ital">a follower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa sibi opus esse, multa canibus suis quos circa se habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors ista quorum hominum est? Volusii haruspices et Canelii medici et horum canum quos tribunal meum vides lambere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">28: apponit de suis canibus quendam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>, § 40; 2, 5, 56, § 146; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 10, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.8" n="3" level="3"> In mythical lang. </sense><sense id="n6506.9" n="a" level="4"> Tergeminus, i. e. Cerberus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 322</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also viperius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartareus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 649" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 1202</bibl></cit>: Echidnaea. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 409</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infernae canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 733</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6506.10" n="b" level="4"> Semidei canes, Anubis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 832</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6506.11" n="4" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n6506.12" n="a" level="4"> Stultitia est venatum ducere invitas canes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.13" n="b" level="4"> Cane pejus et angui Vitare aliquid, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.14" n="c" level="4"> Ut canis a corio numquam absterrebitur uncto, <hi rend="ital">will never be frightened from the greasy hide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.15" n="d" level="4"> Canis caninam non ēst (cf. Engl. <hi rend="ital">dog won</hi>'<hi rend="ital">t eat dog)</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 32</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n6506.16" n="e" level="4"> A cane non magno saepe tenetur aper, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 422</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.17" n="5" level="3"> CAVE CANEM, <hi rend="ital">beware of the dog</hi>, a frequent inscription of warning to trespassers on doors, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 153, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4320</bibl>. —Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">Cave Canem,</quote> <trans><tr>the title of a satire by Varro</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 75, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.18" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> <pb n="279" /> <cb n="CANN" /> </sense><sense id="n6506.19" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A constellation; the Dog.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6506.20" n="1" level="3"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">Canis Major, or simply Canis,</quote> <trans><tr>a constellation of twenty stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:34" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 34</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">of which the brighest is Sirius</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Canicula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 108</bibl> (349); 123 (367); 138 (382); 276 (522); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 218</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 353</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:904" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 904</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 234</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n6506.21" n="2" level="3"> Canis Minor, or Minusculus, <hi rend="ital">the Little Dog</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*proku/wn</foreign>, commonly called Antecanis (hence the <number>plur.</number> canes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 268</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:904" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 904</bibl>.—Acc. to the fable, the dog of Erigone, daughter of Icarius; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Erigoneïus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:723" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 723</bibl></cit>, and Icarius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:939" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 939</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.22" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sea-dog</hi>, called canis marinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 55, § 110</bibl>; and mythically, of <hi rend="ital">the dogs of Scylla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 890</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 549</bibl> Cort.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 351" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 351</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.23" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The worst throw with dice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the dog-throw</hi> (cf. canicula and alea): <cit><quote lang="la">damnosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 46; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:474" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 474</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canem mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 65</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">tam facile quam canis excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apocol. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apocol. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.24" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A Cynic philosopher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diogenes cum choro canum suorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 39, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6506.25" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fetter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 37</bibl> dub. (al. camum; v. camus); cf. 1. catulus.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6507" type="main" key="Ca^nis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river tributary to the Po</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canistellum: <entryFree id="n6508" type="main" key="ca^nistellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănistellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>canistrum, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. cana, p. 45, 19 Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n6508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bread-basket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fruit-basket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:81" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:7:76" default="NO">7, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canistrum: <entryFree id="n6509" type="greek" key="ca^nistrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănistrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănistri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 17, 1</bibl></etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/nastra</foreign>, <sense id="n6509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basket woven from reeds</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">ka/nna</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a bread-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flower-</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">basket</hi> (esp. for religious use in sacrifices), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 13, 28; 4 (5), 8, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 280</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 713</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 675</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:650" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 650</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:277" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6509.1" n="II" level="1"> Canistra siccaria, <hi rend="ital">baskets in which wine stood upon a table</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 706</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canitia: <entryFree id="n6510" type="main" key="ca_ni^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v canities <sense id="n6510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
canities: <entryFree id="n6511" type="main" key="ca_ni^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānĭtĭes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cānĭtĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:169" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 64, § 169</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 41</bibl> P.), em, ē (other cases not in use), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>canus</etym>, <sense id="n6511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gray</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grayish-white color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoariness</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">lupi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 238</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">folia lanatiore canitie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 84, § 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsa marmoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. of the hair, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 425</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 289</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 169</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 131</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6511.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6511.2" n="A" level="2"> (Abstr. pro concr.) <hi rend="ital">Gray hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem terră atque infuso pulvere foedans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 224</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 528</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 611</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem multo deformat pulvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 844</bibl></cit>; 6, 300; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 492</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina canitiem Germanis inficit herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 163</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6511.3" n="B" level="2"> (Effect. pro causa.) <hi rend="ital">A hoary age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old age</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem sibi et longos promiserat annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec virenti canities abest Morosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canitudo: <entryFree id="n6512" type="main" key="ca_ni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (ante-class. access. form of the preced.), <sense id="n6512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gray color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoariness</hi>: capitis, Plaut. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62</bibl> Müll.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 82, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canius: <entryFree id="n6513" type="main" key="Canius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Canius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6513.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Canius. <hi rend="ital">a Roman of learning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 280</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6513.2" n="II" level="1"> Canius Rufus, <hi rend="ital">a poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:61:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 61, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:20:1" default="NO">8, 20, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canna: <entryFree id="n6514" type="greek" key="canna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/nna</foreign>, <sense id="n6514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cane</hi> (less freq. than harundo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:3" default="NO">4, 32, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palustris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:326" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 326</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n6514.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing made of reed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6514.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A reed-pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 682</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:439" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 439</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6514.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gondola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 89</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 56</bibl>. 57, § 206.—</sense><sense id="n6514.4" n="C" level="2"> Canna gutturis. in later medical writers, <hi rend="ital">the windpipe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:16:97" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 16, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:12:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 12, 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cannabinus: <entryFree id="n6515" type="greek" key="canna^bi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cannăbĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kanna/binos</foreign>, <sense id="n6515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of hemp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hempen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">retis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegeticulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:8" default="NO">12, 50, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cannabis: <entryFree id="n6516" type="greek" key="canna^bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cannăbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cannăbum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. sana, the same, Bopp, Gloss. p. 343, a</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/nnabis</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">ka/nnabos</foreign>, <sense id="n6516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hemp; nom.</hi> cannabis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 22, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:173" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 9, 56, § 173</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> cannabim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 6</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> cannabi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 8, § 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cannabe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:146" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 146</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Nom.</hi> cannabum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 27, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> <cb n="CANO" /> cannabi, Isid. l. l. 2; <case>acc.</case> cannabum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5</bibl>; Isid. l. l. 3; <case>abl.</case> cannabo, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cannabius: <entryFree id="n6517" type="main" key="canna^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cannăbĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cannabis</etym>, <sense id="n6517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of hemp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cannae: <entryFree id="n6518" type="main" key="Cannae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cannae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/nnai</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">*ka/nna</foreign>, Polyb.), <sense id="n6518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village in Apulia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of Canusium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for the victory of Hannibal over the Romans; it lay on the east side of the Aufidus</hi> (which is hence called Amnis Canna by Marcius vates ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12, 5</bibl>), now <hi rend="ital">Canne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:44:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 44, 1 sq.</bibl> (Polyb. 3, 113); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cannarum pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 43, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 10</bibl>.—Appellative: <cit><quote lang="la">Capuam Hannibali Cannas fuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>a second Cannœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 21</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6518.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cannensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cannœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cannensian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 3, 10 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 50, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 30, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:35" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <trans><tr>which was cut to pieces at Cannœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 24, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <trans><tr>of those who fell at Cannœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 87</bibl></cit>.—Appel., of the proscription of Sulla: <cit><quote lang="la">te pugna Cannensis accusatorem sat bonum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 89</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of a revel: Cannensis pugna nequitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 38</bibl>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cannenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cannœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cannetum: <entryFree id="n6519" type="main" key="canne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cannētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>canna</etym>, <sense id="n6519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thicket of reeds</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canneus: <entryFree id="n6520" type="hapax" key="canne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cannĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of reeds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reed-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 8</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
canninefates: <entryFree id="n6521" type="main" key="Cannine^fa_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Canninĕfātes</orth>, v. Caninefates.</entryFree>
cannula: <entryFree id="n6522" type="main" key="cannu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cannŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>canna</etym>. <sense id="n6522.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low reed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 224</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n6522.1" n="II" level="1"> (Cf. canna, II. C.) Pulmonis, <hi rend="ital">the windpipe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:152" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cannutius: <entryFree id="n6523" type="main" key="Cannuti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cannutĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cānu-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6523.1" n="I" level="1"> P. Cannutius, <hi rend="ital">an orator in Cicero</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:205" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 56, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 10, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6523.2" n="II" level="1"> Ti. Cannutius, <hi rend="ital">tribune of the people</hi> A. U. C. 710, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:64" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cano: <entryFree id="n6524" type="main" key="ca^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căno</orth>, <itype>cĕcĭni, cantum</itype> (ancient <sense id="n6524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> cante = canite, Carm. Sal. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 37</bibl> Müll.; <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> canerit = cecinerit, Lib. Augur. ap. Fest. s. v. rumentum, p. 270 ib.; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> canui = cecini, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 384</bibl>, predominant in concino, occino, etc.—Examples of <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> cantum and <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> cantus, canturus, a, um, appear not to be in use; the trace of an earlier use is found in Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll.: canta pro cantata ponebant; <cit><quote lang="la">once canituri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 8, 13</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cf. <foreign lang="greek">kana/ssw, kanaxh/, ko/nabos</foreign>; Germ. Hahn; Engl. chanticleer; <foreign lang="greek">ku/knos</foreign>, ciconice; Sanscr. kōkas = duck; Engl. cock], orig. <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to produce melodious sounds</hi>, whether of men or animals; later, with a designation of the subject-matter of the melody, as <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to make something the subject of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s singing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">playing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sing of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">make known in song</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n6524.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to utter melodious notes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6524.2" n="A" level="2"> Of men: <cit><quote lang="la">si absurde canat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebrare dapes canendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si velim canere vel voce vel fidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:2" default="NO">1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum tibicen sine tibiis canere non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 338</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia canentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 587</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1384" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1384</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvo calamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 683</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cithara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lituus quo canitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">movit Amphion lapides canendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 417 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:187" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 50, 187</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6524.3" n="2" level="3"> Of the faulty delivery of an orator, <hi rend="ital">to speak in a sing-song tone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinată ululantique voce more Asiatico canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. canto and canticum.—</sense><sense id="n6524.4" n="B" level="2"> Of animals (usu. of birds, but also of frogs), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 76</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres nullă dulcius arte canant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">merula canit aestate, hieme balbutit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 42, § 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:89" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 32, 47, § 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae alio translatae canunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 227</bibl></cit>.—Of the raven, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 7, 12</bibl>.—Esp., of the crowing of a cock: <cit><quote lang="la">galli victi silere solent, canere victores,</quote> <trans><tr>to crow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 56</bibl></cit>; v. the whole section; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 56</bibl>, § 57; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8</bibl>, <cb n="CANO" /> 2, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 49</bibl> (cf. also cantus): <cit><quote lang="la">gallina cecinit, interdixit hariolus (the crowing of a hen being considered as an auspicium malum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the lang. of the Pythagoreans, of the heavenly bodies (considered as living beings),</quote> <trans><tr>the music of the spheres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 11, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6524.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the instruments by which, or (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) of the places in which, the sounds are produced, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canentes tibiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:8:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestae cecinere tubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">frondiferasque novis avibus canere undique silvas,</quote> <trans><tr>and the leafy forest everywhere resounds with young birds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 256</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 295</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n6524.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make something</hi> or <hi rend="ital">some person the subject of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s singing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">playing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6524.7" n="A" level="2"> With carmen, cantilenam, versus, verba, etc., <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rehearse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Simonides cecinisset, id carmen, quod in Scopam scripsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina quae in epulis canuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum (Cossum) milites carmina incondita aequantes eum Romulo canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ascraeum cano carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 22</bibl>: canere versus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 36</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 222 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl></cit>: idyllia <foreign lang="greek">e)rwtika/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:4:section=10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 4, § 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ad certos modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:388" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit> Spald.—The homog. noun is rarely made the subject of the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> voice: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in ejus conviviis symphonia caneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6524.8" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n6524.9" n="a" level="4"> Carmen intus canere, <hi rend="ital">to sing for one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to consult only one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own advantage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 68</bibl>; v. Aspendius.— </sense><sense id="n6524.10" n="b" level="4"> Cantilenam eandem canis, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">to\ au)to\ a)/(deis a)=sma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">ever the old tune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 10</bibl>; v. cantilena.—</sense><sense id="n6524.11" n="B" level="2"> With definite objects. </sense><sense id="n6524.12" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate in song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sing of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 328</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes mortui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 70</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">canere ad tibiam clarorum virorum laudes atque virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:31" default="NO">1, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 38, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellis carmine modulato laudes virtutum ejus canentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei laudes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>, ext. 8.—So with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere ad tibicinem de clarorum hominum virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. cantito): <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam canit effectos extremus vinitor antes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 417</bibl></cit> Wagn. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil dignum sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam canet indoctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandia elate, jucunda dulciter, moderata leniter canit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Io! magna voce, Triumphe, canet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:118" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 52</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec super arvorum cultu pecorumque canebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 559</bibl></cit> Wagn.: et veterem in limo ranae cecinere querelam, <hi rend="ital">croaked</hi> (according to the ancient pronunciation, kekinere kuerelam, an imitation of the Aristophanic <foreign lang="greek">*brekekeke/c</foreign>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">C</ref></xr>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 378</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 601</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anser Gallos adesse canebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motibus astrorum nunc quae sit causa, canamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt tempestates et fulmina clara canenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6524.13" n="b" level="4"> With pers. objects (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">canitur adhuc barbaras apud gentes (Arminius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculem... ituri in proelia canunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos regesve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liberum et Musas Veneremque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rite Latonae puerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 10, 5: plectro graviore Gigantas, Ov M. 10, 150: reges et proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma virumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnasque virosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:553" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima bella et clarissimos duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 62</bibl></cit>.—Very rarely, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi>, without reference to song or poetry: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus in quădam epistulă amicitiam tuam et Metrodori grata commemoratione cecinerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79, 13</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of fame, <hi rend="ital">to trumpet abroad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama facta atque infecta canit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama digna atque indigna canit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:217 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 217 al.</bibl></cit>—And prov., <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preach to the deaf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non canimus surdis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 8</bibl></cit>: praeceptorum, quae vereor ne vana surdis auribus cecinerim. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6524.14" n="C" level="2"> Since the responses of oracles were given in verse, <hi rend="ital">to prophesy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6524.15" n="a" level="4"> In poetry: <cit><quote lang="la">Sibylla, Abdita quae senis fata canit pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">horrendas ambages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6</bibl></cit>. 99; 3, <pb n="280" /> <cb n="CANO" /> 444: <cit><quote lang="la">fera fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:50" default="NO">1, 6, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:25" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi jam multi crudele canebant Artificis scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6524.16" n="b" level="4"> In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haec quae nunc fiunt, canere di inmortales viderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non haec a me tum tamquam fata... canebantur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum, qui ex Thetide natus esset, majorem patre suo futurum cecinisse dicuntur oracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:1" default="NO">7, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cecinere vates, idque carmen pervenerat ad antistitem fani Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 15, 4</bibl> sq.; 1, 7, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 28, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 16, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of philosophers, etc.: ipsa memor praecepta Canam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque diu latuere, canam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 147</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n6524.17" n="III" level="1"> In milit. lang., t. t., both <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, of signals, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to be sounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6524.18" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicum (lit. and trop.) canere, v. bellicus: classicum, v. classicus: signa canere jubet,</quote> <trans><tr>to give the signal for battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 99:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 99, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius classicum apud eum (sc. Scipionem) cani jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> without <hi rend="ital">signum</hi>, etc.: tubicen canere coepit, Auct. B. Afr. 82; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:66" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6524.19" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam signa canerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut attendant, semel bisne signum canat in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 47, 3</bibl></cit> and 5; 23, 16, 12; <cit><quote lang="la">24, 46 (twice): repente a tergo signa canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 310</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classicum apud eos cecinit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6524.20" n="2" level="3"> Receptui canere, <hi rend="ital">to sound a retreat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubal receptui propere cecinit (i. e. cani jussit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 47, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 26</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cecinit jussos receptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 340</bibl></cit>.—And in Livy <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi receptui cecinisset,</quote> <trans><tr>if it had not sounded a counter-march</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut referrent pedem, si receptui cecinisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 22, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6524.21" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocante et receptui canente senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio abstrahit ab acerbis cogitationibus a quibus cum cecinit receptui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam (orator) in has aetatis (sc. senectutis) veniat insidias, receptui canet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.!*? Examples for the signif. to practice magic, to charm, etc., found in the derivv. cantus, canto, etc., are entirely wanting in this verb.</sense></entryFree>
canon: <entryFree id="n6525" type="greek" key="ca^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> canona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 55</bibl>; <sense id="n6525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> canonas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 136</bibl>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 17, 1</bibl>, used as a Greek word), = <foreign lang="greek">kanw/n [ka/nna, ka/nh</foreign>, a reed, cane]. </sense><sense id="n6525.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A marking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">measuring line;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">model</hi> (cf. Lidd. and Scott, under <foreign lang="greek">kanw/n</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n6525.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6525.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wooden channel in hydraulic instruments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl> Rod.—</sense><sense id="n6525.4" n="B" level="2"> Under the emperors, <hi rend="ital">an annual tribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">established by law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothing</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6525.5" n="C" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a catalogue of sacred writings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as admitted by the rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Canon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Prol. Gal. Aug. Civ. 17, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 15</bibl> and 16.—</sense><sense id="n6525.6" n="D" level="2"> Also in late Lat., from their shape, in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cănŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">cannon</hi>: et illic figere gunnas suas, quas Galli canones vocant, quibus validius villam infestare posset, Thom. Walsingham in Henry V. p. 398.</sense></entryFree>
canonicarius: <entryFree id="n6526" type="main" key="ca^no^ni^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănŏnĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>canon, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n6526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the collector of an annual tribute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov. Const. 30" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov. Const. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canonicus: <entryFree id="n6527" type="greek" key="ca^no^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kanoniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n6527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">according to rule</hi> or <hi rend="ital">measure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6527.1" n="I" level="1"> In music: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <trans><tr>the theory of harmony</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:18:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 18, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6527.2" n="II" level="1"> In astronomy: defectiones solis, <hi rend="ital">as following at regular intervals</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 15.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cănŏ-nĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">theorists</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 14, § 73</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cănŏnĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = canonica ratio, <hi rend="ital">theory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6527.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an annual tribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensitationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod.
