Just.</author> 12, 62, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6527.4" n="IV" level="1"> Eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the canon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canonical</hi>: libri, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Doctr. Christ. 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6527.5" n="V" level="1"> In later eccl. Lat. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cănŏnĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the rule</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discipline</hi>, i. e. clericus, <hi rend="ital">a clergyman</hi>, as distinguished from laicus, <hi rend="ital">one of the people</hi>, and monachus, <hi rend="ital">a recluse</hi>, Antioch. Can. 2, 6, 11; hence the mod. <hi rend="ital">canon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prebendary.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">că-nŏnĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according to Church discipline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canonizo: <entryFree id="n6528" type="main" key="ca^no^nizo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănŏnizo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>canon, II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n6528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="CANT" /> <hi rend="ital">put into the list</hi> or <hi rend="ital">catalogue of saints</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to canonize</hi>, Alex. III. P.P. Ep. 3.</sense></entryFree>
canopus: <entryFree id="n6529" type="main" key="Ca^no_pus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănōpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/nwbos</foreign>, rarely <foreign lang="greek">*ka/nwpos</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 13</bibl>. <sense id="n6529.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An islandtown in Lower Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the western mouth of the Nile;</hi> acc. to the fable, named after the pilot of Menelaus, who died there: Canopus (Canobus in <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 4, 287</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 34, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl>: famosus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">notorious</hi> for its luxury, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 46</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:84" default="NO">6, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 37:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 37, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6529.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Lower Egypt;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 11, 39; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 287</bibl> Heyne.—Also <hi rend="ital">the whole of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6529.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6529.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănōpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Canopus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nili ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:6" default="NO">2, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:62 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 62 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 31, 34, § 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 24, 51, § 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6529.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănōpēus</orth> (four syll.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Canopus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 58</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6529.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănōpītis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">collyrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6529.6" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănōpītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6529.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănō-pītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Canopus</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6530" type="main" key="Ca^no_pus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănōpus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-pŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/nwpos</foreign>, <sense id="n6530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the brightest star in the constellation Argo</hi> (visible in Southern Europe), <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl> (7); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 70, 71, § 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 181</bibl> (scanned Cănŏpŭs, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 808</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
canor: <entryFree id="n6531" type="main" key="ca^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cano</etym>, <sense id="n6531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melody</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; rare). </sense><sense id="n6531.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6531.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cygni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:911" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 911</bibl>: res est blanda canor; <cit><quote lang="la">discant cantare puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulcendas natus ad aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 561</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6531.3" n="B" level="2"> Of instruments, <hi rend="ital">the tone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martius aeris rauci canor,</quote> <trans><tr>martial clang</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6531.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella truci memorata canore,</quote> <trans><tr>in heroic poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canore: <entryFree id="n6532" type="main" key="ca^no_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănōrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. canorus <sense id="n6532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
canorus: <entryFree id="n6533" type="main" key="ca^no_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canor</etym>, <sense id="n6533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to melody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melodious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmonious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">euphonious; neutr.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> (of sound, men, animals, instruments, etc.; class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n6533.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profluens quiddam habuit Carbo et canorum,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing language and a melodious voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce suavi et canoră,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:66:234" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 66, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox Sirenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 311</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 59, 3</bibl>.—As a fault in delivery, <hi rend="ital">singing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sing-song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">droning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine contentione vox, nec languens, nec canora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cano, I. A. 2: canoro quodam modo proclamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:170" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinnitus edere canoros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: nugae, <hi rend="ital">mere jingling</hi> (Voss), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 322</bibl>: plausus, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olyb. 175.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cănō-rum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">melody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, in speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino canorum illud in voce splendescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6533.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6533.3" n="A" level="2"> Of men: <cit><quote lang="la">canorus orator et volubilis et satis acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 27, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:671" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 671</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Gaditana canoro Incipiant prurire choro,</quote> <trans><tr>in song and dance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 162</bibl></cit> Web.: <cit><quote lang="la">Triton,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeolides, i. e. Misenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6533.4" n="B" level="2"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc animal (gallus) sit canorum suă sponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales, i. e. cygnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 34, 84: <cit><quote lang="la">Peneus canorus avium concentu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 26, 32, § 92</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6533.5" n="C" level="2"> Of instruments: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes, i. e. tubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 503</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 704</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chelys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 325" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila lyrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. 14.— Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cănōrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">harmoniously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">musice mundus et canore movetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Doctr. Plat. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. cano, I. B.</sense></entryFree>
canta: <entryFree id="n6534" type="gloss" key="canta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canta</orth>, v. cano <sense id="n6534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cantabilis: <entryFree id="n6535" type="main" key="canta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canto</etym>, <sense id="n6535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy to be sung</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 118, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantabrarius: <entryFree id="n6536" type="main" key="canta^bra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantăbrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cantabrum</etym>, <sense id="n6536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standard-bearer on festive occasions</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 7, 2.</sense></entryFree>
cantabras: <entryFree id="n6537" type="main" key="Canta_^bras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cantā^bras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Indus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tschandrabagha</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 71</bibl> (Cantabas, Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
cantabria: <entryFree id="n6538" type="main" key="Canta^bri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cantăbrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kantabri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a province in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">east of Asturia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the region of the present Biscaya</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 42, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:158" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 16, 47, § 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:48" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 48</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6538.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6538.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cantăber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <cb n="CANT" /> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cantabrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Ser. 74</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cantă-ber</orth>, <itype>ā^bri</itype>, and in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cantā^bri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Cantabrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:9:section=10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 9, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:110 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 110 sq.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">an exceedingly wild and warlike people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose subjugation was attempted in vain by Augustus</hi> (729 A. U. C.), <hi rend="ital">but was accomplished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after a bloody battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by Agrippa</hi> (734 A. U. C.); <cit><quote lang="la">hence, bellicosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indoctus juga ferre nostra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ante domabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippae virtute cecidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serā domitus catenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:46" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6538.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cantā^brĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cantabria</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6538.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cantā^brĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cantabrian bind-weed</hi>: Convolvulus Cantabrica, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 47, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantabricus: <entryFree id="n6539" type="main" key="Canta_^bri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cantā^brĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Cantabria, II. B. and cantabrum, I.</entryFree>
cantabrum: <entryFree id="n6540" type="main" key="canta^brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantăbrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. unknown; the connection with Cantabria is a mere conjecture</etym>. <sense id="n6540.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of bran</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:3" default="NO">4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 1</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 11</bibl> (as an explanation of far caninum); <cit><quote lang="la">hence, cantabricus sucus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 56, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6540.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of banner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">standard under the emperors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantabundus: <entryFree id="n6541" type="main" key="canta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canto</etym>, <sense id="n6541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">singing</hi> (rare: <cit><quote lang="la">sedeo ego cantabundus et stellas numero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 62, 4</bibl></cit>: Gallus suā disciplinā scuto projecto cantabundus (constitit), Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 16</bibl> dub. (Hertz, cunctabundus).</sense></entryFree>
cantamen: <entryFree id="n6542" type="main" key="canta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>canto, III.; cf. cano, II.; cantus, II. B., and carmen; lit. a charming with words; hence, abstr. pro concr.</etym>, <sense id="n6542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magic sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incantation</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 51; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. 40, p. 299</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Sym. 2, 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cantatio: <entryFree id="n6543" type="main" key="canta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>canto; lit. a singing, a playing; hence, abstr. pro concr.</etym>. <sense id="n6543.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Music</hi>, <hi rend="ital">song</hi>, mentioned by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, § 75</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum cantationibus permulcere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:70:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 70, 6</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 19</bibl>, the true reading is cantionem, Fleck.).—* </sense><sense id="n6543.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incantation</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 6.</sense></entryFree>
cantator: <entryFree id="n6544" type="main" key="canta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a musician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minstrel</hi> (mentioned by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 57</bibl> Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">vetus et nobilior Ario cantator fidibus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19</bibl></cit> (transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kiqarw(do/s</foreign>, Herod. 1, 23 Bähr): <cit><quote lang="la">cantator cygnus funeris ipse sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:77" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cantatrix: <entryFree id="n6545" type="main" key="canta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cantator</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n6545.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Musical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">choreae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 448</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cantātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female singer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:19:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 19, 35</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1225</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n6545.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Using enchantments</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 128, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aniculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 123, 25.</sense></entryFree>
canteci: <entryFree id="n6546" type="main" key="Canteci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Canteci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Sarmatia Asiatica, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> Palus Maeotis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canteriatus: <entryFree id="n6547" type="hapax" key="cante_ri^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantērĭātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">canth-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canterius</etym>, <sense id="n6547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supporied by props</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underpropped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canterinus: <entryFree id="n6548" type="main" key="cante_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantērīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">canth-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horse-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus,</quote> <trans><tr>like a horse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>winter barley</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:31" default="NO">2, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapathum = rumex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 85, § 231</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canteriolus: <entryFree id="n6549" type="hapax" key="cante_ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantērĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small trellis for supporting plants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:58" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canterius: <entryFree id="n6550" type="main" key="cante_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantērĭus</orth>, v. cantherius.</entryFree>
canthara: <entryFree id="n6551" type="main" key="Cantha^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Canthăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantharias: <entryFree id="n6552" type="greek" key="cantha^ri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canthărĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kanqari/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n6552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone having in it the figure of a Spanish fly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantharis: <entryFree id="n6553" type="greek" key="cantha^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canthăris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kanqari/s</foreign>. <sense id="n6553.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A genus of beetle</hi>, of several species; <cit><quote lang="la">in pure Lat. scarabaeus parvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 30, § 94</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. used in medicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 35, 41, § 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:93" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 30, § 93</bibl>.—Esp. <hi rend="ital">the</hi> (very poisonous) <hi rend="ital">Spanish fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cantharides</hi>: Meloe vesicatorius, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:306" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 306</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 30, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:118" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 35, 41, § 118</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6553.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A worm injurious to the vine and rose</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 6</bibl> and 4; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 152</bibl>. <pb n="281" /> <cb n="CANT" /></sense></entryFree>
cantharites: <entryFree id="n6554" type="greek" key="cantha^ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canthărītes vīnum</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">kanqari/ths oi)=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n6554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantharolethros: <entryFree id="n6555" type="main" key="Cantha^ro^le^thros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Canthărŏlĕthros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kanqaro/leqros</foreign> (death to beetles), <sense id="n6555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Thrace near Olynthus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo unum hoc animal exanimatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 84, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cantharulus: <entryFree id="n6556" type="main" key="cantha^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canthărŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cantharus</etym>, <sense id="n6556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small drinking-vessel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 209</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6556.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small candlestick</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 22, 462</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantharus: <entryFree id="n6557" type="greek" key="cantha^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canthărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/nqaros</foreign>. <sense id="n6557.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wide-bellied drinking-vessel with handles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tankard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pot</hi> (very frequent in Plaut.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 23 al.</bibl>—Esp. used by Bacchus and his followers, as scyphus, by Hercules, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 17</bibl> Voss; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 25</bibl>. —Hence Marius was reproached, because, after the conquest of the Cimbri, he drank from the cantharus like a triumphing Bacchus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 6</bibl>, n. 6.—Gr. <case>acc.</case> cantharon, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 3, 48</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6557.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6557.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A water-pipe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:41:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 41, § 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 182, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6557.3" n="B" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a vessel of holy water</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 37, 150</bibl> (v. Quicherat ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n6557.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6557.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A black spot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wart under the tongue of the Egyptian Apis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 46, 71, § 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantherius: <entryFree id="n6558" type="main" key="canthe_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canthērĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cantērĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. <foreign lang="greek">kanqh/lios</foreign>, a beast of burden</etym>. <sense id="n6558.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A gelding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 15</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6558.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An ass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mule</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Nat. 1, 14</bibl>.—Prov.: minime, sis, cantherium in fossam, <hi rend="ital">put the hack in the ditch</hi>, when it is useless, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 47, 6</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n6558.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6558.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A man impotent through age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6558.4" n="B" level="2"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">a spar under the roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rafter</hi>, Fr. chevron, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6558.5" n="C" level="2"> In the lang. of vine-dressing, <hi rend="ital">a pole furnished with cross-pieces for supporting the vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trellis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:4:14" default="NO">4, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:62" default="NO">11, 3, 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6558.6" n="D" level="2"> Among veterinary surgeons, <hi rend="ital">a kind of frame for suspending sick horses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 47, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canthus: <entryFree id="n6559" type="greek" key="canthus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/nqos</foreign>; lit. <sense id="n6559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the iron ring around a carriage-wheel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the tire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 88</bibl>, where it is considered as barbarian (African or Spanish).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6559.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">a wheel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:71" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6560" type="main" key="Canthus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Canthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/nqos</foreign>, <sense id="n6560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name of an Argonaut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 3</bibl> and 6.</sense></entryFree>
canticulum: <entryFree id="n6561" type="main" key="canti^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>canticum</etym>. * <sense id="n6561.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sonnet</hi>: Zephyri, Septim. Afer. ap. Ter Maur. p. 2427 P.—</sense><sense id="n6561.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A short incantation</hi>, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 482, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canticum: <entryFree id="n6562" type="main" key="canti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cantus</etym>. <sense id="n6562.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a song in the Roman comedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sung by one person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and accompanied by music and dancing; a monody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosti canticum (in Demiurgo Turpilii), meministi Roscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desaltare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrio in cantico quodam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neroniana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atellanis notissimum canticum exorsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6562.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A song</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">chorus canticum Insonuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canticum repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne convivium obscenis canticis strepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:23" default="NO">1, 10, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:14" default="NO">1, 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:35" default="NO">9, 2, 35</bibl>; 11, 3, 13.—</sense><sense id="n6562.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp. Canticum Canticorum, <hi rend="ital">the Song of Songs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Canticles</hi>, Vulg.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6562.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A singing tone</hi> in the delivery of an orator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:13" default="NO">11, 3, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6562.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lampoon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a libellous song</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 75, p. 322, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6562.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A magic formula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incantation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 301, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canticus: <entryFree id="n6563" type="main" key="canti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canto</etym>, <sense id="n6563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">musical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delinimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cantilena: <entryFree id="n6564" type="main" key="canti^le_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantĭlēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cantillo</etym>. <sense id="n6564.0" n="I" level="1"> In anteclass. and class. lang., <hi rend="ital">a song</hi>, in a disparaging sense, <hi rend="ital">an old song;</hi> vulg. for <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trite prattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gossip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut crebro mihi insusurret cantilenam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: totam istam cantilenam ex hoc pendere, ut quam plurimum lucri faciant, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 2</bibl>: qui non Graeci alicujus cottidianam loquacitatem sine usu, neque ex scholis cantilenam requirunt, Cic. <cb n="CANT" /> de Or. 1, 23, 105.—Prov.: cantilenam eandem canis, = <foreign lang="greek">to\ au)to\ a)/(deis a)=(sma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">ever the old song</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6564.1" n="II" level="1"> Postclass. in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">a song</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 14</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cantilenis et proverbiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 47, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantilenas meditari pro jubilo molliores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">a lampoon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 7, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181, 16</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cantilenosus: <entryFree id="n6565" type="main" key="canti^le_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantĭlēnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cantilena</etym>, (post-class.), <sense id="n6565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantillo: <entryFree id="n6566" type="main" key="cantillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n6566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dim. a.</hi> [canto], <hi rend="ital">to sing low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hum</hi> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in App.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 1, p. 342, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 388, 13 al.</sense></entryFree>
cantio: <entryFree id="n6567" type="main" key="canti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cano, lit. a singing, playing; hence meton. abstr. pro concr.</etym>. <sense id="n6567.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A song</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly ante-class.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of birds,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 349, 11</bibl></cit>; Fronto ad Ver. 1 (cf. cantatio).—</sense><sense id="n6567.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An incantation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spell</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito totam causam oblitus est, idque veneficiis et cantionibus Titiniae factum dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, 10, p. 106, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantito: <entryFree id="n6568" type="main" key="canti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n6568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. act.</hi> [canto; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, § 75</bibl> Müll.; 8, 33, § 119], <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">play often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut habeas quīcum cantites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina in epulis esse cantitata a singulis convivis de clarorum virorum laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 75</bibl></cit> (cf. cano, II. B.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce cantitant aves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 175</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cantium: <entryFree id="n6569" type="main" key="Canti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cantĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/ntion</foreign>, <sense id="n6569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory of England</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantiuncula: <entryFree id="n6570" type="hapax" key="canti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cantio</etym>, <sense id="n6570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flaitering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alluring strain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cantiunculis (sc. Sirenum) tantus vir inretitus teneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canto: <entryFree id="n6571" type="main" key="canto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n6571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cano], <hi rend="ital">freq.</hi> in form, but mostly agrees in meaning with cano. </sense><sense id="n6571.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to produce melodious sounds</hi> (by the voice or an instrument), <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; rare in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n6571.2" n="A" level="2"> Of men: <cit><quote lang="la">Pamphilam Cantatum provocemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltare et cantare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim vocum suavitate videntur aut novitate quădam cantandi revocare eos solitae (sirenes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcades ambo Et cantare pares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantando victus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:66" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adimam cantare severis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (cantores) numquam inducant animum cantare rogati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl>: non est Cantandum, <hi rend="ital">there is no occasion for singing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for imagination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 35</bibl>.—Of an actor: <cit><quote lang="la">cantante eo (Nerone) ne necessariă quidem causă excedere theatro licitum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">under II. B. 2.: conducta veni, ut fidibus cantarem seni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">structis avenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad chordarum sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. of instrumental music, and only with <case>abl.</case> of the instrument (cf. cano): <cit><quote lang="la">tibiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> praef. § 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 7, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lituo, tubă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:6:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: ad manum histrioni, in comedy, <hi rend="ital">to sing and play while the actor accompanies the song with gestures</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dancing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelo cantatur et psallitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">surdo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 47, and ad surdas aures, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 61</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">to preach to deaf ears;</hi> cf. cano, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n6571.3" n="2" level="3"> Of the singing pronunciation of an orator, <hi rend="ital">to declaim in a singing tone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawl</hi>: si cantas, male cantas, si legis, cantas, C. Caesar ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:56" default="NO">11, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:57" default="NO">11, 3, 57</bibl>; 11, 3, 58; 11, 3, 59; 11, 3, 60; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:178" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 178</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to recite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declaim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque sedens modo legerat, haec eadem... cantabit versibus isdem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 153</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6571.4" n="B" level="2"> Of birds and fowls: <cit><quote lang="la">prius quam galli cantent,</quote> <trans><tr>crow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 96</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">deos gallis signum dedisse cantandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantantes aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 30.—</sense><sense id="n6571.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of instruments, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastoris bucina cantat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 30: <cit><quote lang="la">cantabat fanis, cantabat tibia ludis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:659 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 659 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6571.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make some person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing the subject of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s singing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">playing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">song</hi> (cf. cano, II.). </sense><sense id="n6571.7" n="A" level="2"> With the song itself, <hi rend="ital">carmen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versus</hi>,<cb n="CANT" />  etc., as object, <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina non prius Audita canto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rustica verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:52" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hymen cantatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 137</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hymenaeum qui cantent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:676" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 676</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6571.8" n="B" level="2"> With particular persons or things, the subjects of song, as objects, <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">praise in song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sing of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write poetry upon</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">celebrem deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:83" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absentem amicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia, proelia virginum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augusti tropaea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythia (sc. certamina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantari dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per totum cantabimur orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa meis multum cantata libellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:50:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantatus Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:658" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 658</bibl></cit>. —Esp., </sense><sense id="n6571.9" n="2" level="3"> Of an actor, <hi rend="ital">to represent a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act</hi> (cf. supra, I. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">cantavit (Nero) Orestem matricidam, Oedipodem excaecatum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nioben,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragoedias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 46</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epinicia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n6571.10" n="C" level="2"> Hence, because the oracles were of old uttered in verse, of any mysterious, prophetic, or warning utterance, <hi rend="ital">to predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera cantas? vana vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>. —Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">urna haec litterata est: ab se cantat cuja sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civi inmoeni scin quid cantari solet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6571.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring something repeatedly to recollection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reiterate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harp upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forewarn of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dies noctes canto, ut caveas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam, ut scis, jam pridem istum canto Caesarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11</bibl></cit> (13), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fati provida cantet avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me juvene utique cantare solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6571.12" n="III" level="1"> In the lang. of religion, as <pos>v. n.</pos> or <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to use enchantments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incantations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enchant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to charm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 160, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus in pratis cantando rumpitur anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantata Luna,</quote> <trans><tr>exorcised by magic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:430" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum quoque cantato densetur carmine caelum,</quote> <trans><tr>an incantation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 369</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6571.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To call forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce by charms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et chelydris cantare soporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:498" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantata umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 767</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cantor: <entryFree id="n6572" type="main" key="cantor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cano</etym>, <sense id="n6572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a singer</hi>, <hi rend="ital"><usg type="style">poet.</usg></hi> </sense><sense id="n6572.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus hoc vitium est cantoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 129</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 2, 3 (mutato nomine cantorem pro musico dicit, Acron.): Thamyras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 22, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">cantor Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 407</bibl></cit> (cf. Apollo): <cit><quote lang="la">(Caligula) Threx et auriga idem cantor atque saltator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl></cit>.—In a contemptuous sense: <cit><quote lang="la">cantor formularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 236</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 132</bibl>.— And with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the person (conformably to cano, II. B.), <hi rend="ital">an extoller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eulogist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantores Euphorionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6572.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in the lang. of the drama, = <foreign lang="greek">xoreuth/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an actor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">player</hi> (cf. G. Herm. Opusc. I. p. 298), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec cantor vos plaudite! dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cantrix: <entryFree id="n6573" type="main" key="cantrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cantor</etym>, <sense id="n6573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female singer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a songstress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves cantrices,</quote> <trans><tr>singing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cantulus: <entryFree id="n6574" type="hapax" key="cantu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cantus</etym>, <sense id="n6574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little song</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 12.</sense></entryFree>
canturio: <entryFree id="n6575" type="main" key="cantu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n6575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cano], <hi rend="ital">to chirp</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">canturire melicam, belle diverbia dicere (vulg.: canturire belle diverbia, adicere melicam),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> Paul. ex Fest. s. v. dagnades, p. 68.</sense></entryFree>
cantus: <entryFree id="n6576" type="main" key="cantus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cantus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the production of melodious sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a musical utterance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expression</hi>, either with voice or instrument; hence, <hi rend="ital">song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">playing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">music</hi> (while carmen is prop. the contents or substance of the song, etc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui enim cantus moderatā oratione dulcior invenire potest? Quod carmen artificiosā conclusione aptius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 8, 34</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n6576.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n6576.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n6576.3" n="1" level="3"> With the voice, <hi rend="ital">a singing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">song;</hi> in full, cantus vocum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit etiam saepe vocum gravitate et cantibus ut pellantur animi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 36, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus vocis juvat sociatā nervorum concordiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3</bibl></cit>, <pb n="282" /> <cb n="CANU" /> 23: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comissationes, cantus, symphoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1406</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices cantus ore sonante dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantu tremulo (i.e. voce anili),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipe lugubres Cantus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum cantu solata laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 293</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est etiam in dicendo quidam cantus obscurior,</quote> <trans><tr>musical play of voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6576.4" n="2" level="3"> With instruments, <hi rend="ital">a playing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">music</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nervorum vocumque cantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribili stridebat tibia cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querulae tibiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis tibia cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:47" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ac tubarum est auditus cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibicines, qui fidibus utuntur, suo arbitrio cantus numerosque moderantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantu tubarum convocare concilium, Auct. B. G. 8, 20: raucisonoque mi-nantur cornua cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rauco strepuerunt cornua cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of an actor: tardiores tibicinis modos et cantus remissiores facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6576.5" n="B" level="2"> Of birds, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">raucisoni cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1084" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1084</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus avium et volatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 349</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—Of the nightingale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 81</bibl>.—Of the cock, <hi rend="ital">a crowing</hi>: (galli) favent faucibus russis cantu plausuque premunt alas, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 57</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 251 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 26, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub galli cantum,</quote> <trans><tr>at daybreak</tr>, <tr>cock-crowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigil ales cristati cantibus oris Evocat Auroram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 597</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulix fundens e gutture cantus, Cic. Div, poët. 1, 8, 14: perdix testata gaudia cantu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seros exercet noctua cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cycni) cantus dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 398</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6576.6" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6576.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prophetic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oracular song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veridicos Parcae coeperunt edere cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 306</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6576.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An incantation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magic song</hi>, etc.: cantusque artesque magorum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 201</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at cantu commotae Erebi de sedibus imis Umbrae ibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:367" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haemoniis agitare cantibus umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:448" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores Cantibus solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:45" default="NO">1, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:53" default="NO">1, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus e curru Lunam deducere tentat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:63" default="NO">4, 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:4:10" default="NO">4, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
