canua: <entryFree id="n6577" type="gloss" key="canua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">canua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. canifera.</entryFree>
canuleius: <entryFree id="n6578" type="main" key="Ca^nu^le_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănŭlēius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n6578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. Thus, C. Canuleius, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people.</hi> Acc. to a law proposed by him (Canuleium plebiscitum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl>) A.U.C. 310, marriage between patricians and plebeians was allowed; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:25" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canus: <entryFree id="n6579" type="main" key="ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. Kas-, to shine; cf. cascus</etym>, <sense id="n6579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoary</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n6579.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 767</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 71</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>foamy</tr>, <tr>frothy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nix,</quote> <trans><tr>white</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruina,</quote> <trans><tr>hoar-frost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandine canus Athos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:200" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:456" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:527" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 527</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 550: favilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:524" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum villi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 23, 50, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 55, § 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6579.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. freq. of <hi rend="ital">the gray hair of the aged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cano capite atque albā barbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 266</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 474</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 350</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 427</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:36 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 36 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. capilli), <hi rend="ital">gray hairs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cani, non rugae repente auctoritatem arripere possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 275</bibl>; in Aug. and post-Aug. poets (esp. freq. in Ovid) with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:567" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:391" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:65" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 65</bibl></cit>: venerandi. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1249" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1249</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6579.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of age and of aged persons. <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <trans><tr>hoary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:108:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 108, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 61, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: cana veritas, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 243, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vesta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 744</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canusium: <entryFree id="n6580" type="main" key="Ca^nu^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănŭsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănŭsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <cb n="CAPE" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1037, 3</bibl>), <sense id="n6580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town in Apulia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Canosa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded by the Greeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and celebrated for its excellent wool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl>, D, § 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 52, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:190" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 48, 73, § 190</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 168</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6580.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6580.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănŭsīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Canusium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Canusian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rufae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:129" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">birri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6580.3" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6580.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănŭsīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Canusium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilinguis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>speaking Greek and Latin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6580.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănŭsīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vestis), <hi rend="ital">garments made of Canusian wool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:127" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 127</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6580.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănŭsīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">clothed in Canusian wool</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:23:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 23, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
canutus: <entryFree id="n6581" type="gloss" key="ca_nu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānūtus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">polio/s</foreign>, canus, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
capabilis: <entryFree id="n6582" type="main" key="ca^pa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>, = capax (late Lat.): <sense id="n6582.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">infirmitatis capabilis (Dei virtus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malitiae capabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6582.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehensible</hi>, Aug. contr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Maxim.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capacitas: <entryFree id="n6583" type="main" key="ca^pa_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>capax</etym>, <sense id="n6583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a capability of holding much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capacity</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n6583.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum capacitatem aliquam in animo putamus esse, quo tamquam in aliquod vas, ea, quae meminimus, infundantur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 47, 66, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moduli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 26" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 26</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6583.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in the Lat. of the jurists. <hi rend="ital">a capability of entering upon an inheritance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right of inheritance</hi> (cf. capio, I. B. 2. b. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">capax, II. B.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:55:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 55, § 1</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 9, 42, 1 pr.—</sense><sense id="n6583.3" n="B" level="2"> Intellectually, <hi rend="ital">capacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehension</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 17, 1, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capaciter: <entryFree id="n6584" type="main" key="ca^pa_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. capax <sense id="n6584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
capaneus: <entryFree id="n6585" type="main" key="Ca^pa^neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpăneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kapaneu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n6585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Hipponŏus and Astynome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 70" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 70</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">one of the seven before Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struck with lightning by Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 404</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:549" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 549</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 898</bibl> sq.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Capanei, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 34, 40.— <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Capanea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 144</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi> Capaneu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6585.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpănēus</orth> (four syll.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Capaneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Capanean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:811" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 832</bibl></cit>.— And access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpănēia</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:545" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 545</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capax: <entryFree id="n6586" type="main" key="ca^pax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>, <sense id="n6586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can contain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hold much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capacious</hi> (in poets and in post-Aug. prose freq.; in Cic. perh. only once, and then trop; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n6586.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: mundus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capaciores scyphos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:568" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:439" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatiosa et capax domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa usibus capax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma capacissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circus capax populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi vinique capacissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen onerariarum navium capax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 1, 5, § 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae sedis insula haud capax est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6586.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6586.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Capacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">susceptible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capable of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit for</hi>: Demosthenes non semper implet aures meas: ita sunt avidae et capaces, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <trans><tr>great</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi ad praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:243" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo majora capaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capax est animus noster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 30</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal mentis capacius altae (i.e. homo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas honorum nondum capax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molis tantae mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1,11</bibl></cit>: secreti, <hi rend="ital">that can keep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capacia bonae spei pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnorum operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium omnium bonarum artium capacissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: cujusque clari operis capacia ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum et capax recta discendi ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris ac fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 127, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia fecunda et totius naturae capacissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 78, 80, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doli,</quote> <trans><tr>fit</tr>, <tr>suitable for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6586.4" n="B" level="2"> In the Lat. of the jurists (cf. capio, II. F.), <hi rend="ital">that has a right to an inheritance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 3, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căpācĭter</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capedo: <entryFree id="n6587" type="main" key="ca^pe_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpēdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">căpūdo</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>capis</etym>, <sense id="n6587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bowl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cup used in sacrifices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 2, 2</bibl>; cf. the foll. and capis. <cb n="CAPE" /></sense></entryFree>
capeduncula: <entryFree id="n6588" type="hapax" key="ca^pe_duncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpēduncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>capedo</etym>, <sense id="n6588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bowl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dish used in sacrifices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capella: <entryFree id="n6589" type="main" key="ca^pella1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caper; cf.: puer, puella</etym>, <sense id="n6589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a she-goat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6589.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 19, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:49" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:691 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 691 al.</bibl>—A piece of statuary, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 87</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6589.2" n="2" level="3"> As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">a dirty fellow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 8</bibl> (cf. canicula).—</sense><sense id="n6589.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A star on the left shoulder of the constellation Auriga</hi> (usu. called capra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 248</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">rising in the rainy season;</hi> hence, sidus pluviale capellae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 594</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum pluviale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6590" type="main" key="Ca^pella2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpella</orth>. <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6590.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An elegiac poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 36</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6590.2" n="II" level="1"> Capella Antistius, <hi rend="ital">a teacher of rhetoric</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6590.3" n="III" level="1"> Martianus Mineus Felix Capella, <hi rend="ital">a learned grammarian of Madaura</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the second half of the fifth century;</hi> his Satyricon treats of the liberal arts.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpel-lĭānus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Capella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capellianus: <entryFree id="n6591" type="hapax" key="ca^pelli^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpellĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. capella</etym>, <sense id="n6591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to kids</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goats</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruta,</quote> <trans><tr>readily eaten by them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capellus: <entryFree id="n6592" type="gloss" key="ca^pellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caper</etym>, <sense id="n6592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small goat</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 617</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capena: <entryFree id="n6593" type="main" key="Ca^pe_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Tuscan town founded by the Veientes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or at least dependent upon them</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Martino</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 697</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 10</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">in their territory were the grove and temple of Feronia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 26, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6593.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6593.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpēnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpēnā-tis lūcus</orth>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 629</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">of Capena</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 24, 3</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Capenati bello, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agro Capenate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capenate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 26, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capenates,</quote> <trans><tr>the inhabitants of Capena</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: Capenas, also <hi rend="ital">a little stream in the grove of Feronia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:84" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6593.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Capena</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 697</bibl></cit>: Porta Capena, <hi rend="ital">a gate in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the eastern district</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Porta S. Sebastiano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:47" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caper: <entryFree id="n6594" type="main" key="ca^per"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căper</orth>, <itype>pri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">ka/pros</foreign>, wild boar</etym>, <sense id="n6594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a he-goat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a goat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6594.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 305</bibl>; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificed to Bacchus (because injurious to the vine),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 329</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6594.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the odor of the armpits</hi> (cf. capra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Ovid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6594.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A star in the left shoulder of the constellation Auriga</hi> (also called capella), <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 178</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 658</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:94" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 94</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6594.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a kind of fish found in the river Acheloüs said to make a grunting sound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 267</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caperenses: <entryFree id="n6595" type="main" key="Ca^pe^renses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĕrenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capero: <entryFree id="n6596" type="main" key="ca^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. kamp-, to tremble</etym> (ante- and postclass.). <sense id="n6596.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wrinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw together in wrinkles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugis frontem contrahere, a frontibus crispis caprorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 8, 31</bibl></cit>: frons caperata, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 204, 30</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 107 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">caperatum supercilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224</bibl></cit>: vela, <hi rend="ital">furled</hi>, id. Flor. n. 23.—</sense><sense id="n6596.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wrinkled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 3</bibl> (also in <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 9, 1</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
capesso: <entryFree id="n6597" type="main" key="ca^pesso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpesso</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">căpisso</orth>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 227, 1</bibl>), īvi (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 68</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 49</bibl>), or ii (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 30</bibl>: capessi, given by <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 367</bibl> P., and by Charis. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 902</bibl> ib., but apparently erroneously; cf. Struve, p. 198, and lacesso), ītum (acc. to Prisc. l. l. <sense id="n6597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> capessiturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 48</bibl>), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. desid. a.</hi> [capio]. </sense><sense id="n6597.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">catch at eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to snatch at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi> (capesso = desidero capere, Prisc. l. l.; <cit><quote lang="la">rare but class.): alia animalia cibum partim oris hiatu et dentibus ipsis capessunt, partim unguium tenacitate adripiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 234</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 378</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6597.2" n="B" level="2"> Of relations of place, <hi rend="ital">to strive to reach a place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to betake one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resort to;</hi> constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> ante-class. <pb n="283" /> <cb n="CAPI" /> also capere se in or ad aliquem locum. </sense><sense id="n6597.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes mundi partes undique medium locum capessentes nituntur aequaliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiora capessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Melitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:316" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:480" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 480</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6597.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Se in or ad aliquem locum: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis te in altum capessis, tam aestus te in portum refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc pergam... me domum capessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 346</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6597.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adverb. dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo nunc capessis te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6597.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6597.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take hold of any thing with zeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take in hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi> (the most usu. signif.; cf. I. A.): Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 227, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ad senem cursum capessam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus imperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform</tr>, <tr>execute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; so, capessere rem publicam, <hi rend="ital">to undertake affairs of state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to engage in public affairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer</hi> (differing, by the idea of zealous co-operation and activity, from accedere ad rem publicam, which designates merely the entering upon a public office or duty), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:29:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 29, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 85, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 69, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:39:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigintiviratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia in republică,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 14</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">curas imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem cum honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 9</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <trans><tr>to commence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to take to flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principium facinoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem in castris tutam et vigilem,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divorsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 68</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">tuta et salutaria,</quote> <trans><tr>to adopt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 48</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 9, 19</bibl>: recta, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6597.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to lay hold of with the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in capessendis naturae sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6597.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To betake one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter upon</hi> (cf. I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">quam (filius) se ad vitam et quos ad mores praecipitem inscitus capessat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6597.10" n="2" level="3"> With the idea of completed action, <hi rend="ital">to attain to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reach a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>: neque (te) posse corde capessere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v 44 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
capetus: <entryFree id="n6598" type="main" key="Ca^pe^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous king of Alba</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 613</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caphareus: <entryFree id="n6599" type="main" key="Ca^pha_reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căphāreus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căphēreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kafareu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n6599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rocky promontory on the southern coast of Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the homeward-bound fleet of the Greeks was wrecked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">being misled by Nauplius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of the island</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Palamedes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who had been slain before Troy;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Capo del Oro</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Xylofago</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 116" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 472</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 481</bibl>.— Gr. <case>acc.</case> Căphārĕă, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 472</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 83</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Caphareu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:371" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 371</bibl>.—Form Caphereus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6599.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6599.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căphārēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (four syll.), <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kafh/reios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Caphareus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 36</bibl></cit>.—Scanned Căphārĕa; <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 7, 39; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 116" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6599.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căphā-ris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kafhri/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Caphareus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 805" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 805</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capidulum: <entryFree id="n6600" type="gloss" key="ca^pi^du^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭdŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĕd-</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> Gloss. p. 446</bibl> Mai), <sense id="n6600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of covering for the head</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
capillaceus: <entryFree id="n6601" type="main" key="ca^pilla_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capillus</etym>, <sense id="n6601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hairy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6601.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Similar to hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 25, 48, § 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6601.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Made of hair</hi>: zona, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8.</sense></entryFree>
capillago: <entryFree id="n6602" type="hapax" key="ca^pilla_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hair</hi>, collect., <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capillamentum: <entryFree id="n6603" type="main" key="ca^pilla_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n6603.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The hair</hi>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 16, § 38</bibl>; esp. <hi rend="ital">false hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a peruke</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 110, 5</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6603.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> <cb n="CAPI" /> </sense><sense id="n6603.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hairy threads</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fibres of the roots</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leaves of plants</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">capillamenta vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:4" default="NO">4, 22, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 31, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:105" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 80, § 105</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6603.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hair-like streaks on precious stones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rimae simile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:68" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 5, 18, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capillaris: <entryFree id="n6604" type="main" key="ca^pilla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capillus</etym>, <sense id="n6604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the hair</hi>: herba, <hi rend="ital">the plant otherwise called</hi> Capillus Veneris, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 47</bibl>: arbor, = arbor capillata; v. capillatus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n6604.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. unguentum), <hi rend="ital">an unguent for the hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pomatum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capillatio: <entryFree id="n6605" type="main" key="ca^pilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>capillatus</etym>. <sense id="n6605.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the being hairy;</hi> and then per meton., <hi rend="ital">the hair</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. ad Sev. 23, 23</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6605.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disease of the urinary organs;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">trixi/asis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:60" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capillatura: <entryFree id="n6606" type="main" key="ca^pilla_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, prop., <sense id="n6606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the being hairy;</hi> and then per meton., <hi rend="ital">the hair;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">false hair</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 190</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:35" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:4:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 1, 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:9:41" default="NO">2, 9, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6606.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the hair-like streaks in precious stones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capillatus: <entryFree id="n6607" type="main" key="ca^pilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of capillor, not in use, <sense id="n6607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hairy</hi> (cf. barbatus): <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens bene capillatus,</quote> <trans><tr>with a fine head of hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillatior quam ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.— As a designation of a primitive age (since the hair was not then shorn; v. barba and barbatus): (vinum) capillato diffusum consule, i.e. <hi rend="ital">very old wine</hi>, Juv 5, 30.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">fronte capillată, post est occasio calva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Dist. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl> sqq.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">young aristocrats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:57:31" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 57, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6607.1" n="B" level="2"> Capillata vel capillaris arbor, <hi rend="ital">a tree on which the Vestal virgins suspended their shorn hair</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 85, § 235</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6607.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">consisting of slender fibres</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 31, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 24, 38, § 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capillitium: <entryFree id="n6608" type="main" key="ca^pilli^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>capillus</etym>, <sense id="n6608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hair</hi>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 331</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capillor: <entryFree id="n6609" type="main" key="ca^pillor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillor</orth>, v. capillatus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6610" type="gloss" key="capillor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capillor</orth>, <itype>species stativi auguril, cum auspicato arbor capitur et consecratur Jovis fulguri</itype>, Serv ad Verg A. 10, 423.</entryFree>
capillosus: <entryFree id="n6611" type="hapax" key="ca^pillo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capillus</etym>, <sense id="n6611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very hairy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:67" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capillulus: <entryFree id="n6612" type="hapax" key="ca^pillu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n6612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0524,001:6" default="NO"><author>Corn. Gall.</author> 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capillus: <entryFree id="n6613" type="main" key="ca^pillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">căpillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 97</bibl>, acc to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 198, 20</bibl>) [a <lbl>dim.</lbl> form, akin to caput and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kefalh/</foreign>; lit., <pos>adj.</pos> sc. crinis]. <sense id="n6613.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the hair of the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the hair</hi> (while crinis is any hair). </sense><sense id="n6613.1" n="A" level="2"> Collect. (hence, acc. to Varr, ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 80</bibl> P. in his time used only in the <number>sing.</number>; but the <hi rend="ital">plur</hi> is found once in Cic., and since the Aug. poets very freq.) capillus passus, prolixus, circum caput Rejectus neglegenter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 49</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versipellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositus (or -um, acc. to Non. l. l.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 97</bibl></cit>; Ter Eun. 4, 3, 4 Ruhnk.; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 2, 21: compositus et delibutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horridus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissus,</quote> <trans><tr>long hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longus barbaque promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: horrens. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">niger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 273</bibl></cit> (opp. barba): <cit><quote lang="la">virgines tondebant barbam et capillum patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum et barbam promisisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 231</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6613.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hair</hi> (<number>sing.</number> very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in imaginem capilli unius sat multorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:11:29" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 11, 29</bibl></cit>.—So <number>plur.</number> (freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl> (4), 6, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 29, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 15</bibl>; 3, 20, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO">11, 3, 160</bibl> (in Ov. M. alone more than fifty times).—</sense><sense id="n6613.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6613.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hair of men</hi> gen., both of the head and beard: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius cultros metuens tonsorios, candente carbone sibi adurebat capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit> Beier (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut barbam et capillum sibi adurerent): ex barbā capillos detonsos neglegimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6613.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hair of animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuniculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membranae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CAPI" /> 10; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6613.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The threads</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fibres of plants</hi>, Phn. 21, 6, 17, § <cit><quote lang="la">33: capillus in rosā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 18, 73, § 121</bibl></cit>; hence, capillus Veneris, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> herba capillaris, <hi rend="ital">maidenhair</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capio: <entryFree id="n6614" type="main" key="ca^pi^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, captum</itype> (old <sense id="n6614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> capso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 61</bibl>: capsit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 66, 27</bibl>, or Ann. v. 324 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 6</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 483, 12</bibl>, or Trag. Rel. v. 454 Rib.; Paul. ex. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">capsimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: capsis, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl>, = cape si vis, but this is an error; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 66</bibl>; old <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> cepet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Rostr. 5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Rostr. 5</bibl>; v. Wordsworth, Fragm. and Spec. p. 170), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">kw/ph</foreign>, handle; Lat. capulum; Engl. haft; Germ. Heft; Sanscr. root hri-, take; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xei/r</foreign>, Engl. and Germ. hand, and Goth. hinthan, seize</etym>. </sense><sense id="n6614.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6614.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to take in hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasp</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sumo, prehendo): si hodie hercule fustem cepero aut stimulum in manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape hoc flabellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cepit manibus tympanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, genitor, cape sacra manu patriosque Penatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape saxa manu, cape robora, pastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acria pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 9, 57: <cit><quote lang="la">baculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colum cum calathis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:475" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem ternis digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 48, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:13:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 13, 9, § 6</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is in caveā pignus capiatur togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 68</bibl></cit>: rem manu, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem pignori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:15:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 15, § 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:15:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 1, 15, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum laevā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capias tu illius vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: cape vorsoriam, <hi rend="ital">seize the sheet</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">take a tack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn about</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 19</bibl>.—Very freq. of arms (cf. sumo); so in gen.: arma, <hi rend="ital">to take up arms</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">engage in war</hi> or <hi rend="ital">battle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 36, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B.G. 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 2</bibl>; 52, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 38, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:102:12" default="NO" valid="yes">102, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:115 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 115 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 221</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of particular weapons: ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:307" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 307</bibl></cit>; 5, 366 et saep.—Of food, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partake of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quīcum una cibum Capere soleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauti cibum capiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n6614.4" n="1" level="3"> Of living objects. </sense><sense id="n6614.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take into possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take captive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make prisoner.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6614.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum expugnavimus, et legiones Teleboarum vi pugnando cepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 258</bibl></cit>: summus ibi capitur meddix, occiditur alter, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 296 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam belli nefarios duces captos jam et comprehensos tenetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi Orgetorigis filia atque unus e filiis captus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges capiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1013" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1013</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capta eo proelio tria milia peditum dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Byzantii ceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captos ostendere civibus hostes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captus Tarento Livius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus ex hoste captus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 67</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">captus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = captivus, <hi rend="ital">a prisoner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">captive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in captos clementiā uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inludere capto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit fiducia capto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex captorum numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 10</bibl></cit>;
