<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 1</bibl>.—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">capta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female captive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam hanc esse captam ex Cariā, Ditem ac nobilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Of animals, birds, fish, etc., <hi rend="ital">to catch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hunt down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>: quid hic venatu non cepit? Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 253, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ab avibus capiundis auceps dicatur, debuisse ajunt ex piscibus capiundis, ut aucupem, sic piscicupem dici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 8, § 61</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic jaculo pisces, illa capiuntur ab hamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 763</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quicquam captum'st piscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quid concharum capsimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 27</bibl>: acipenserem, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Nereus) tibi prius vinclis capiendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 396</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To win</hi>, <hi rend="ital">captivate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enchain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enslave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fascinate;</hi> mostly with <hi rend="ital">abl. of means: Ph.</hi> Amore ardeo. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quid agas? nisi ut te redimas captum quam queas Minumo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod insit in iis aliquid probi, quod capiat ignaros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <pb n="284" /> <cb n="CAPI" /> animum adulescentis... pellexit eis omnibus rebus, quibus illa aetas capi ac deleniri potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis voluptate capiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem quidem adeo suā cepit humanitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secum habuit Pomponium, captus adulescentis et humanitate et doctrinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec bene promeritis capitur (deus), nec tangitur irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 651</bibl></cit>: ut pictura poësis; <cit><quote lang="la">erit quae si propius stes Te capiat magis, et quaedam si longius abstes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc capit argenti splendor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te conjux aliena capit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthia prima suis miserum me cepit ocellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine formosae, pretio capiuntur avarae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munditiis capimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 465</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 802</bibl>; 8, 124; 8, 435; 9, 511; 10, 529; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 373: amore captivae victor captus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcedine vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 709</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 170</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce novā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:678" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperie aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:344" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bos) herbā captus viridi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoenitate loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque honoris neque pecuniae dulcedine sum captus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendore hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: ne oculis quidem captis in hanc fraudem decidisti; <cit><quote lang="la">nam id concupisti quod numquam videras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mislead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis hanc vim esse maximam, cavere ne capiatur, ne fallatur videre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurium autem'st ulcisci advorsarios? Aut quā viā te captent eādem ipsos capi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: uti ne propter te fidemque tuam captus fraudatusque sim, form. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem captus errore quo nos,</quote> <trans><tr>involved in the same error</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 253, 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quo errore milites caperentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere ante dolis Reginam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captique dolis lacrimisque coactis (Sinonis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi me eisdem dolis non quit capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentium animi molles et aetate fluxi dolis haud difficulter capiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capi alicujus dolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolum ad capiendos eos conparant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas callida Colchis (i.e. Medea) amicitiae mendacis imagine cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 301</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.10" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To defeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi> in a suit or dispute (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tu si me impudicitiae captas, non potes capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu caves ne tui consultores, ille ne urbes aut castra capiantur (cf. B. 2. b. infra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidus et in capiendo adversario versutus (orator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:178" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 178</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.11" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To deprive</hi> one <hi rend="ital">of his powers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faculties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harm.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6614.12" n="(a)" level="5"> Of the physical powers, <hi rend="ital">to lame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutilate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi> in the limbs, senses, etc. (only <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> capi, and esp. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> captus): <cit><quote lang="la">mancus et membris omnibus captus ac debilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Hannibal ... altero oculo capitur,</quote> <trans><tr>loses an eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captus omnibus membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capti auribus et oculis metu omnes torpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 58, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis membrisque captus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 24, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congerantur in unum omnia, ut idem oculis et auribus captus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si captus oculis sit, ut Tiresias fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit filium captum altero oculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censorem Appium deum irā post aliquot annos luminibus captum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:17" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:204" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps pedibus captus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">captum leto posuit caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 830</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the mole: aut oculis capti fodere cubilia talpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 183</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Of the mental powers, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of sense</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intellect;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> captus, usu. agreeing with pers. subj., and with <case>abl.</case> mente, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crazy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crazed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lunatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labi, decipi tam dedecet quam delirare et mente esse captum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino aut somno oppressi aut mente capti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely mentibu' capti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1022" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1022</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 107" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 107</bibl></cit>; very rarely with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">captus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 73</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines captae furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26, 12</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. agreeing with mens or animus: <cit><quote lang="la">viros velut mente captā cum jactatione fanaticā corporis vaticinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captis magis mentibus, quam consceleratis similis visa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 18, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capti et stupentes animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 36, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.14" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pick out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adopt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi> a <cb n="CAPI" /> person for a particular purpose or to sustain a particular office or relation: <cit><quote lang="la">de istac sum judex captus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aricini atque Ardeates de ambiguo agro... judicem populum Romanum cepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 71, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me cepere arbitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te mihi patronam capio, Thais,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom illum generum cepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non, si capiundos mihi sciam esse inimicos omnis homines,</quote> <trans><tr>make them enemies thereby</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis magistrum cepit ad eam rem inprobum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—So the formula of the Pontifex Maximus, in the consecration of a vestal virgin: sacerdotem Vestalem, quae sacra faciat... ita te, Amata, capio, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique autem capi virginem solam debere dici putant, sed flamines quoque Diales, item pontifices et augures capi dicebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ne eā causā pontifex capiar?... ecquis me augurem capiat? Cat. ib. § 17: Amata inter capiendum a pontifice maximo appellatur, quoniam, quae prima capta est, hoc fuisse nomen traditum est, Gell. ib. § 19: rettulit Caesar capiendam virginem in locum Occiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio, quae in annos singulos Jovis sacerdotem sortito capi jubeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Flaccus flamen captus a P. Licinio pontifice maximo erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n6614.15" n="2" level="3"> Of places. </sense><sense id="n6614.16" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter into;</hi> mostly milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to take up a position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select a place</hi> for a camp, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">loca capere, castra munire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris locum capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum capere castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non fugiendi hostis, sed capiendi loci causā cessisse videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Thebanos transfugere velle, et locum extra urbem editum capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte mediā profectus, ut locum quem vellet, priusquam hostes sentirent, caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem elegantius loca cepisse, praesidia disposuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat autem Philopoemen praecipuae in ducendo agmine locisque capiendis solertiae atque usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum cepere paulo quam alii editiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces, ut quisque locum ceperat, cedere singulos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 2, 46</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">of position on the battle-field: quod mons suberat, eo se recipere coeperunt. Capto monte, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuit non solum ales captam semelsedem, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem quis in pugnando ceperat locum, eum amissā animā corpore tegebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 2</bibl>; rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum suis cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 41, 9</bibl></cit>, for a tomb: LOCVM SIBI MONVMENTO CEPIT. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 346, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for taking the auspices' se (Gracchum) cum legeret libros, recordatum esse, vitio sibi tabernaculum captum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Palatium Romulus, Remus Aventinum ad inaugurandum templa capiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for refuge: omnes Samnitium copiae montes proximos fugā capiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 43, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anchises natum Conventus trahit in medios... Et tumulum capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 753</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 562</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante locum capies oculis ( = eliges),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 230</bibl></cit> Serv. ad loc.: nunc terras ordine longo Aut capere aut captas jam despectare videntur (cycni), <hi rend="ital">to select places on which to light</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to be just settling down on places already selected</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 396</bibl> Forbig. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n6614.17" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take by force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invadam extemplo in oppidum antiquom: Si id capso, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: oppidum vi, Cat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, p. 191</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">MACELLAM OPPVGNANDO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Rostr. Inscr. Orell. 549" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Rostr. Inscr. Orell. 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">CORSICAM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 551</bibl></cit>: oppida, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 9, p. 868</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 487 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad alia oppida pergit, pauca repugnantibus Numidis capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 4</bibl> (4, 3), 16: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojā captā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 191</bibl>: Coriolos. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 71, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem opulentissimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oppidum Nolam fortissuma Samnitium castra cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursu oppidanorum facto scalis vacua defensoribus moenia capi possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimas hostium vestrorum in Hispaniā urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 39, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedem belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:74:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 74, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl> (B. 1. d. supra).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppressā captāque re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: qui, bello averso ab hostibus, patriam suam cepissent, Liv. <cb n="CAPI" /> 3, 50, 15.—</sense><sense id="n6614.18" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betake one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi> (mostly by ships, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">insulam capere non potuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerariae duae eosdem quos reliqui portus capere non potuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidit uti, ex iis (navibus) perpaucae locum caperent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae naves, cum ignorarent, quem locum reliquae cepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: praemiis magnis propositis, qui primus insulam cepisset, Auct. B. Alex. 17.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui... tenere cursum possint et capere otii illum portum et dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:46:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 46, 99</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6614.19" n="3" level="3"> Of things of value, property, money, etc. </sense><sense id="n6614.20" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">AVRVM, ARGENTVM,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Rostr. Inscr. Orell. 549" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Rostr. Inscr. Orell. 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de praedonibus praedam capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros de hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:49:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 49, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ager ex hostibus captus viritim divideretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinqueremem una cum defensoribus remigibusque, Auct. B. Alex. 16, 7: naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cim. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnas praedas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hostibus pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">e nostris spolia cepit laudibus, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22: signum ex Macedoniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Verr. 2:4:58:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum pulcherrimum Carthagine captum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 2:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 38</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">82: sed eccam ipsa egreditur, nostri fundi calamitas: nam quod nos capere oportet, haec intercipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape cedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut reliqui fures, earum rerum quas ceperunt, signa commutant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri non solum id, quod de Campanis (agri) ceperant, non imminuerunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te duce ut insigni capiam cum laude coronam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 95</bibl></cit>.—With abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatem adeo facile perpessus est, ut de republicā nihil praeter gloriam ceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ceteri, qui per eum aut honores aut divitias ceperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam formam hujus cepi in me et statum,</quote> <trans><tr>assumed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare non committeret, ut is locus ex calamitate populi Romani nomen caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum Tiberinus ab illis Cepit,</quote> <trans><tr>succeeded to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 615</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.21" n="b" level="4"> In particular connections. </sense><sense id="n6614.22" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pecuniam</hi> (freq. joined with concilio; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">to take illegally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept a bribe. take blackmail</hi>, etc., esp. of magistrates who were accused de pecuniis repetundis: <cit><quote lang="la">his ego judicibus non probabo C. Verrem contra leges pecuniam cepisse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">HS. quadringentiens cepisse te arguo contra leges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>, § 26; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid ab horum quopiam captum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">27: tamen hae pecuniae per vim atque injuriam tuam captae et conciliatae tibi fraudi et damnationi esse deberent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">91: utrum (potestis), cum judices sitis de pecuniā captā conciliatā, tantam pecuniam captam neglegere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 94</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">218: quid est aliud capere conciliare pecunias. si hoc non est vi atque imperio cogere invitos lucrum dare alteri?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">71: sequitur de captis pecuniis et de ambitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita aperte cepit pecunias ob rem judicandam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos censores furti et captarum pecuniarum nomine notaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 42, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum commemoro rapinas, non exactas pecunias, non captas, non imperatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis ob rem judicandam pecuniam cepisset... neque solum hoc genus pecuniae capiendae turpe, sed etiam nefarium esse arbitrabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 32, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab regibus Illyriorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 45, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitiae captarumque pecuniarum teneri reum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.23" n="(b)" level="5"> Of inheritance and bequest, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inherit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex hereditate nihil ceperit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off, 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui morte testamentove ejus tantundem capiat quantum omnes heredes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abdicatus ne quid de bonis patris capiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut non justum testamentum est, aut capere non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si capiendi Jus nullum uxori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui testamentum faciebat, ei, qui usque ad certum modum capere potuerat, legavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: quod ille plus capere non poterat, ib. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex bonis testatoris solidum capere non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:6:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:6:30" default="NO">39, 6, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.24" n="(g)" level="5"> Of regular income, revenue, etc., rents, tolls, profits, etc., <hi rend="ital">to collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>: nam ex <pb n="285" /> <cb n="CAPI" /> eis praediis talenta argenti bina Capiebat statim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capit ille ex suis praediis sexcenta sestertia, ego centena ex meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium jure belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquagena talenta vectigalis ex castro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal ex agro eorum capimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadragena annua ex scholā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si recte habitaveris... fundus melior erit... fructūs plus capies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.25" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6614.26" n="1" level="3"> Of profit, benefit, advantage, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reap</hi> (mostly in phrase fructum capere): <cit><quote lang="la">metuit semper, quem ipsa nunc capit Fructum, nequando iratus tu alio conferas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honeste acta superior aetas fructus capit auctoritatis extremos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iis etiam fructum capio laboris mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus (litteris) cepi fructum duplicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo majorem fructum ex populi existimatione illo damnato cepimus, quam ex ipsius, si absolutus esset, gratiā cepissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum immortalem vestri in me et amoris et judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fructum dulcedinis almae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:971" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 971</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1410" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1410</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 32</bibl>.—In other connections: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ex eā re tandem ut caperes commodi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitates ex amicitiā maximas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usuram alicujus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.27" n="2" level="3"> Of external characteristics, form, figure, appearance, etc., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestum atque voltum novom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 50</bibl></cit>' faciem aliquam cepere morando, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 421</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 605</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuras Datque capitque novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:309" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam capit quam lilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 212</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duritiam ab aëre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:751" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 751</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem capere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take root</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pali defixi radices cepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 17, 27, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siliculam capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturitatem capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:23:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix libere capit viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires cepisse nocendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(telinum) rursus refrigeratum odorem suum capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.28" n="3" level="3"> Of mental characteristics, habits, etc., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adopt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape sis virtutem animo et corde expelle desidiam tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re si Glabrionis patris vim et acrimoniam ceperis ad resistendum hominibus audacissimis, si avi prudentiam ad prospiciendas insidias, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando, patres conscripti, patrium animum virtutemque capiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem exercitationemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (adsuetudinem) tu dum capias, taedia nulla fuge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam principum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:46" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 46</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum animis avidis... neque lex neque tutor capere est qui possit modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit> Wagn. ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n6614.29" n="4" level="3"> Of offices, employments, duties, etc., = suscipio, <hi rend="ital">to undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam olim populi prius honorem capiebat suffragio, Quam magistro desinebat esse dicto oboediens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Geta, provinciam Cepisti duram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in te cepi Capuam, non quo munus illud defugerem,</quote> <trans><tr>took command at Capua</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8</bibl></cit>. 3, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 21, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 21</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capiatque aliquis moderamina (navis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum moderamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:677" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontificatum maximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve cui patrum capere eum magistratum liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ceperat haud tumultuose magistratum majore gaudio plebis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to obtain for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres praeturam Sp. Furio Camillo gratiā campestri ceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.30" n="5" level="3"> In gen., of any occupation, work, or undertaking, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">augurium ex arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augurium capienti duodecim se vultures ostenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castris Romanis cum frustra multi conatus ad erumpendum capti essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus impetu capto enituntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 65, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 43</bibl>: cursum,<cb n="CAPI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus temporibus scribendi capiatur exordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">experimentum eorum inversā manu capitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 2, 3, § 19</bibl></cit> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec vestra capit discordia finem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to take to flight</tr>, <tr>flee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>; so, capere impetum, <hi rend="ital">to take a start</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather momentum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad impetum capiundum modicum erat spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditionis Germanicae impetum cepit,</quote> <trans><tr>suddenly resolved to make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl></cit>: capere initium, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pars artis, ex quā capere initium solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum (finium) una pars, quam Gallos optinere dictum est, initium capit a flumine Rhodano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a dis inmortalibus sunt nobis agendi capienda primordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.31" n="6" level="3"> Of an opportunity or occasion, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si occassionem capsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lubitum fuerit, causam ceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tempus conveniundi patris me capere suadeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si satis commode tempus ad te cepit adeundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.32" n="7" level="3"> Of operations of the mind, resolutions, purposes, plans, thoughts, etc., <hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ex ipsā re conjecturam cepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit> MSS. (Fleck. al. ex conj. fecimus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam ex diei tempore conjecturam ceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujusce rei conjecturam de tuo ipsius studio, Servi, facillime ceperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjecturam capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quid corde nunc consili capere possim, Scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capti consili memorem mones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Stich 4, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto porro possim Potiri consilium volo capere unā tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerarium consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tale capit consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 3</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confitendum... eādem te horā consilium cepisse hominis propinqui fortunas funditus evertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito consilium cepi, ut exirem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> —With <hi rend="ital">gen. gerund.</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">legionis opprimendae consilium capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obprimundae reipublicae consilium cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sibi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id non fecisset, sibi consilium facturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ego rationem oculis capio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cepi rationem ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.33" n="8" level="3"> Of examples, instances, proofs, etc., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo documentum nos capere fortuna voluit quid esset victis extimescendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid istuc tam mirum'st, de te si exemplum capit? Ter And. 4, 1, 26: exemplum ex aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesagia a sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 78, § 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud num dubitas quin specimen naturae capi debeat ex optimā quāque naturā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.34" n="9" level="3"> Of impressions, feelings, etc., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be subjected to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experience</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum laborem capere ob talem filium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes mihi labores fuere quos cepi leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem inanem ipsus capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo nunc misera quem capit Laborem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: miseriam omnem ego capio; <cit><quote lang="la">hic potitur gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satietatem dum capiet pater Illius quam amat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus aegri ex abitu viri quam ex adventu voluptatis cepi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illā quācum volt voluptatem capit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 114: <cit><quote lang="la">angor iste, qui pro amico saepe capiendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (benevolentia) quidem capitur beneficiis maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam quam capiebam memoriā rationum inventorumque nostrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenire desiderium quod capiebat e filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinione omnium majorem animo cepi dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque cepi voluptatem, tam ornatum virum fuisse in re publicā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex civibus victis gaudium meritum capiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quam... invidiam apud patres ex prodigā largitione caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam laetitiam meam, quam ex tuo reditu capio, magnus illius adventu cumulus accedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Att. 4:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 19, 2</bibl></cit>(4, 18, 3): <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia, quam oculis cepi justo interitu tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 14:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praealto tecto lapsus matris et adfinium cepit oblivionem,</quote> <trans><tr>lost his memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 24, 24, § 90</bibl></cit>: virtutis opinionem, Auct. B. G. 8, 8: <cb n="CAPI" /> somnum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl>: taedium vitae, Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 18, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">maria aspera juro Non ullum pro me tantum (me) cepisse timorem, Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 352</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">et in futurum etiam metum ceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis alienis voluptatem capere laetitiae (cum sit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque mihi solā capitur nunc mente voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.35" n="10" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with the feelings, experience, etc., as subj., <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, etc. (cf. <foreign lang="greek">lamba/nw</foreign>, in this sense and like 9. supra): nutrix: Cupido cepit miseram nunc me, proloqui Caelo atque terrae Medeaï miserias, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 291 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">edepol te desiderium Athenarum arbitror cepisse saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam commerui merito ut caperet odium illam mei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi eum satietas Hominum aut negoti odium ceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos post reges exactos servitutis oblivio ceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te cepisse odium regni videbatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulum Remumque cupido cepit urbis condendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido eum ceperat in verticem montis ascendendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam victores sanguinis caedisque ceperat satietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 49, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pavor hic, qui terror, quae repente oblivio animos cepit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblivio deorum capiat pectora vestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:46:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 46, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantane te cepere oblivia nostri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut animum ejus cura sacrorum cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis primum admiratio cepit, quidnam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta meae si te ceperunt taedia laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 332</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> I. p. 178</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">I. p. 196 Burm.: ignarosque loci passim et formidine captos Sternimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix, quae tanta animum dementia cepit!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 465</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum subita incautum dementia cepit amantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 488</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> I. p. 170, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">I. p. 168, 14 Burm.: Tarquinium mala libido Lucretiae stuprandae cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens quidem et luctus et pavor civitatem cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus repente maeror pavorque senatum eorum cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum metus cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: si me... misericordia capsit. Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 483, 11</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 454 Rib.): nec tuendi capere satietas potest, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 410 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">quantus timor socios populi Romani cepisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.36" n="11" level="3"> Of injury, damage, loss, etc., <hi rend="ital">to suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be subjected to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 16, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrimenti aliquid in aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in the legal formula, by which dictatorial powers were conferred by the senate upon the consuls or the entire magistracy in times of extreme danger to the state; <cit><quote lang="la">videant ne quid res publica detrimenti capiat: decrevit quondam senatus, ut L. Opimius consul videret ne quid res publica detrimenti caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hernici tantum terrorem incussere patribus, ut, quae forma senatūs consulti ultimae semper necessitatis habita est, Postumio, alteri consulum, negotium daretur, videret, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 19, 2</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod plerumque in atroci negotio solet, senatus decrevit, darent operam consules, ne quid, etc.... Ea potestas per senatum more Romano magistratui maxuma permittitur, exercitum parare, bellum gerere, coërcere omnibus modis socios atque civis, domi militiaeque inperium atque judicium summum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 2 sq.</bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n6614.37" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be large enough for.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6614.38" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6614.39" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Sitit haec anus. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quantillum sitit? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Modica'st, capit quadrantal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parte quod ex unā spatium vacat et capit in se (ferrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1030" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1030</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam mare litus habet, plenos capit alveus amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 344</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra feras cepit, volucres agitabilis aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tenues capiat suus alveus undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:558" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctosque (deos) dedisse Terga fugae, donec fessos Aegyptia tellus Ceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:324" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 324</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.40" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with negatives, <hi rend="ital">not to hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be too small for</hi>, etc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">di boni, quid turba est! Aedes nostrae vix capient, scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum unā domo jam capi non possunt, in alias domos exeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54</bibl></cit>: nec jam se capit <pb n="286" /> <cb n="CAPI" /> unda; <cit><quote lang="la">volat vapor ater ad auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tuus hoc capiet venter plus ac meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non capit se mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 487" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim capiebant funera portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium populi vix capiente domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si di habitum corporis tui aviditati animi parem esse voluissent, orbis te non caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non immerito proditum sit... Graeciam omnem vix capere exercitum ejus (Xerxis) potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6614.41" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6614.42" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To swallow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take in</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tot domus locupletissimas istius domus una capiet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.43" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To contain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be large</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strong enough for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6614.44" n="a" level="4"> Affirmatively (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid mortalitas capere poterat, implevimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si puer omni curā et summo, quantum illa aetas capit, labore, scripserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dummodo ejus aetatis sit, ut dolum capiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.45" n="b" level="4"> With negatives: <cit><quote lang="la">non capiunt angustiae pectoris tui (tantam personam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones, qui... nec capere irarum fluctus in pectore possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec capiunt inclusas pectora flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix spes ipse suas animo capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardet et iram Non capit ipsa suam Progne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:610" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 610</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic quoque concupiscis quae non capis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majora quam capit spirat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimum magnitudinem ejus (fortunae) non capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirma aetas majora non capiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6614.46" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to admit of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be capable of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rimam fissuramque non capit sponte cedrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 78, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molluscum... si magnitudinem mensarum caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 16, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res non capit restitutionem, cum statum mutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.47" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be susceptible of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be of a nature to</hi>, etc., = <foreign lang="greek">e)nde/xetai</foreign> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec capit humanis angoribus excruciari (Deus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina, quae non capiunt indulgeri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Haer. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 9, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6614.48" n="5" level="3"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive into the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi> (cf. intellego, to penetrate mentally, have insight into): <cit><quote lang="la">sitque nonnumquam summittenda et contrahenda oratio, ne judex eam vel intellegere vel capere non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam esse gratiam tantam, quam non vel capere animus meus in accipiendo... posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quidem ego nisi tam magna esse fatear, ut ea vix cujusquam mens aut cogitatio capere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N.
