D. 1, 19, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus ille, quem qui ex regibus constare dixit, unus veram speciem Romani senatus cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnium laetius, quam quod mentes eorum capere possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 14</bibl></cit>.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Capta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Minerva</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as worshipped on the Cœlian Mount</hi>, but for what reason is not known, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:837 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 837 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6615" type="main" key="ca^pi^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. capio</etym>; in the Lat. of the jurists, <sense id="n6615.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 10, 3.—</sense><sense id="n6615.1" n="II" level="1"> = usu capio or usucapio, <hi rend="ital">the right of property acquired by prescription</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:48:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 48, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:21" default="NO">41, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:5:4" default="NO">41, 5, 4</bibl>; v. 1. usucapio.</sense></entryFree>
capis: <entryFree id="n6616" type="greek" key="ca^pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prob. akin to capio, q. v., but cf. <foreign lang="greek">kufo/s</foreign>, bent; <foreign lang="greek">ku/pellon</foreign>, cup; and <foreign lang="greek">ku/w</foreign>, to hold</etym>, <sense id="n6616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bowl with one handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially used in sacrifices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenitur etiam haec capis (capidis), cujus diminutivum est capidula: et vide quod magis Graecum esse ostenditur, cum in as protulit accusativum pluralem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 708</bibl></cit> P.; cf. also Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48</bibl> Müll.; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 547, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 7, § 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52, 2</bibl>; v. capedo.</sense></entryFree>
capisso: <entryFree id="n6617" type="main" key="ca^pisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpisso</orth>, <itype>ere</itype>, v. capesso.</entryFree>
capisterium: <entryFree id="n6618" type="greek" key="ca^piste_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpistērĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skafisth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n6618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for cleansing grains of corn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 11</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
capistrarius: <entryFree id="n6619" type="main" key="ca^pistra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpistrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>capistrum</etym>, <sense id="n6619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a halter-maker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capistro: <entryFree id="n6620" type="main" key="ca^pistro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpistro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">āvi</orth>), <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n6620.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To halter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie with a halter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 80</bibl>; Sid, Carm. 22, 23.—* </sense><sense id="n6620.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the vine, <hi rend="ital">to bind fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:95" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capistrum: <entryFree id="n6621" type="main" key="ca^pistrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpistrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>capio</etym>. <sense id="n6621.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A halter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a muzzle of leather</hi> for animals, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">forbei/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 188</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 399</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6621.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: maritale capistrum,<cb n="CAPI" />  <hi rend="ital">the matrimonial halter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 43</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6621.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, </sense><sense id="n6621.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A band for fastening up vines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:20:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 20, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6621.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A band for the wine-press</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capital: <entryFree id="n6622" type="main" key="ca^pi^tal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtal</orth>, v. capitalis.</entryFree>
capitalis: <entryFree id="n6623" type="main" key="ca^pi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caput</etym>. <sense id="n6623.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the head.</hi> In this signif. extant only in the <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> capital, <hi rend="ital">a headdress of priests</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=130" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 130</bibl> Müll.; but, capital linteum quoddam, quo in sacrificiis utebantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48</bibl> ib. —</sense><sense id="n6623.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6623.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which life is endangered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capital</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <trans><tr>peril of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>endangering life</tr>, <tr>dangerous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6623.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp. freq. as jurid. t. t. of those crimes which are <hi rend="ital">punishable by death</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by the loss of civil rights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capital</hi>, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:23:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 23, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:1:2" default="NO">48, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusare aliquem rei capitalis,</quote> <trans><tr>of a capital crime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in vinculis essent damnati rei capitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui rei capitalis dies dicta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus rerum capitalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:39:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 39, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifesti rerum capitalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum capitalium condemnati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rerum capitalium quaestionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>, § 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl>: facinora, Cic. poët. N. D. 1, 6, 13; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flagitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maleficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 18</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">judex rei capitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:30:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 30, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitalium rerum vindices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem admittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenā afficere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condemnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadversione punire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicio incesta coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitale nullum exemplum vindictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitalis locus ubl si quid violatum. est, caput violatoris expiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium trium virorum capitalium,</quote> <trans><tr>who had charge of the prisons and of executions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 1, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 26, 17</bibl>; and the joke of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 2</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtal</orth> (postAug. sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtāle</orth>, as also in poorer MSS. of earlier authors), <number>plur.</number> capitalia, <hi rend="ital">a death</hi> (<hi rend="ital">real</hi> or <hi rend="ital">civil</hi>), <hi rend="ital">banishment</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">in consequence of crime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capital = facinus quod capitis poenā luitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37</bibl></cit>: capital <foreign lang="greek">kefalikh\ timwri/a</foreign>, Vet. Gloss. </sense><sense id="n6623.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Capital facere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 26</bibl>: scimus capital esse irascier, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 38, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quique non paruerit capital esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio decedere apud Romanos capital esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 37, 9</bibl></cit> Gronov.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl> Tzschuck; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:34" default="NO">8, 9, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">degredi viā capital leges fecere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:62" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 23, 31, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl> Oud. and Wolf; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:155" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 155</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:4:6:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 4, 6, 3</bibl> Oud.—</sense><sense id="n6623.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Capitale: <cit><quote lang="la">capitale est obicere anteacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6623.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitalia: capitalia vindicanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitalia ausi plerique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 40, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6623.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicus,</quote> <trans><tr>a mortal enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <trans><tr>a deadly enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:23:section=25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 23, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae, Cod. 2, 20, 7: oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>very pernicious</tr>, <tr>dangerous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitalis et pestifer Antonii reditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius autem injustitiae nulla capitalior quam eorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla capitalior pestis quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6623.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That is at the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi> in something, <hi rend="ital">pre-eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi> (rare): capitale vocamus Ingenium sollers (as we often use <hi rend="ital">capital</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:839" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 839</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculus ille (sc. Philistus) capitalis, creber, acutus, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>a writer of the first rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11</bibl></cit> (13), 4: jocus, <hi rend="ital">a capital joke</hi>, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 10. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc autem erat capitalior, quod, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>more important</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 170</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mortally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capitally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odisse,</quote> <trans><tr>mortally</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 11</bibl></cit>.—Esp., </sense><sense id="n6623.9" n="2" level="3"> As judicial t. t., of punishments, <hi rend="ital">capitally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so as to affect life</hi> or <hi rend="ital">citizenship</hi>, Cod. Th. 3, 14, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capitaneus: <entryFree id="n6624" type="hapax" key="ca^pi^ta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caput</etym>, <sense id="n6624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chief in size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>: litterae, <hi rend="ital">capitals</hi>, Auct. Rei Agr. p. 270 Goes. <cb n="CAPI" /></sense></entryFree>
capitarium: <entryFree id="n6625" type="gloss" key="ca^pi^ta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtārĭum aes</orth> <itype>quod capi potest</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
capitatio: <entryFree id="n6626" type="main" key="ca^pi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caput</etym>; <sense id="n6626.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in the Lat. of jurists,</quote> <trans><tr>a poll-tax</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18" default="NO">50, 4, 18</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 3, 2</bibl> (ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl>: exactio capitum).—</sense><sense id="n6626.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The outlay of the state for beasts used in the public service</hi>, Cod. Th. 7, 4, 8; 7, 4, 11.</sense></entryFree>
capitatus: <entryFree id="n6627" type="main" key="ca^pi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a head</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">clavulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: et crassa natrix, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 65, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caepa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 6, 22, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 113, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 10, 44, § 126</bibl></cit>: vinea, <hi rend="ital">a vine that grows in a head</hi> (opp. bracchiata), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 9</bibl> and 11.</sense></entryFree>
capitellum: <entryFree id="n6628" type="main" key="ca^pi^tellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caput, capitulum</etym> (perh. first post-class., for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 113, § 173</bibl>, and 36, 23, 56, § 178, the MSS. and edd. vary between capitellum and capitulum; not in use in the time of Varro; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 79</bibl> Müll.). <sense id="n6628.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paracenterii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6628.1" n="II" level="1"> In architecture = capitulum, <hi rend="ital">the capital of a column</hi>, Coripp. 4, 59; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capitilavium: <entryFree id="n6629" type="main" key="ca^pi^ti^la^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtĭlăvĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>caput-lavo</etym>, <sense id="n6629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing of the head</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 18, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capitinus: <entryFree id="n6630" type="main" key="Ca^pi^ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n6630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the town Capitium</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*kapu/tion</foreign>, Ptol., in Southern Sicily, now <hi rend="ital">Capizzi</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capitium: <entryFree id="n6631" type="main" key="ca^pi^ti^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>caput</etym>, <sense id="n6631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering for the head</hi>: capitia = capitum tegmina, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 542, 25</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">an undervest</hi>, as put over <hi rend="ital">the head</hi>, though Varr. derives it from capio: <cit><quote lang="la">capitium ab eo quod capit pectus, id est, ut antiqui dicebant, comprehendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=131" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl></cit> Müll.: induis, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 9</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 61 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A vestment of a priest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6631.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The opening in the tunic through which the head passed</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vest. Sacerd. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39, 21</bibl>; id. Job, 30, 18.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6632" type="main" key="Ca^pi^ti^um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capito: <entryFree id="n6633" type="main" key="ca^pi^to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n6633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amplif.</hi> [caput], <hi rend="ital">one that has a large head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">big-headed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6633.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6633.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6633.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-fish with a large head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> cephalus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 158, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6633.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fish with a large head</hi>: Cyprinus dobula, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6634" type="main" key="Ca^pi^to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, Atteius Capito; v. Atteius.; esp. in the gens Sestia; v. Fast. Capitol. ap. Grut. 289; <cit><quote lang="la">and sarcastically,</quote> <trans><tr>a name given to parasites</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; v. the commentt. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
capitolinus: <entryFree id="n6635" type="main" key="Ca^pi^to_li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭtōlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Capitolium</etym>, <sense id="n6635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Capitol</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Capitoline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:12:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 12, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">area,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl>.—Of Jupiter, Auct. Dom. 57, 144; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <trans><tr>that was given to Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora, q. v.: ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <trans><tr>a crown of oak given to victors in the Capitoline games</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:387" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 387</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6635.1" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6635.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭtōlīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Capitoline Hill</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6635.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭtōlīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">persons who had the charge of these games</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 2</bibl>.— In <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a cognomen of</hi> M. Manlius, <hi rend="ital">on account of his rescue of the Capitol</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 24" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capitolium: <entryFree id="n6636" type="main" key="Ca^pi^to_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭtōlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kapitw/lion</foreign> [ = capitulum, from caput]; in a restricted sense, <sense id="n6636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Capitol</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the temple of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built on the summit of</hi> Mons Saturnius <hi rend="ital">or</hi> Tarpeius <hi rend="ital">by the Tarquinii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards splendidly adorned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55, 1 sq.</bibl>; v. Class. Dict.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 448</bibl>; opp. to the Arx, and separated from it by the Intermontium.—In a more extended sense, <hi rend="ital">the whole hill</hi> (hence called Mons or Clivus Capitolinus), <hi rend="ital">including the temple and citadel</hi>, separated from the Palatine Hill by the Forum Romanum, now <hi rend="ital">Campidoglio.</hi> Acc. to a fanciful etym., this word is derived from the discovery of a man's head in laying the foundations of the temple, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 41</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55, 6</bibl>: <pb n="287" /> <cb n="CAPO" /> which <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 345</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 194</bibl>, also give as the head of a certain Tolus or Olus. The Capitolimn was regarded by the Romans as indestructible, and was adopted as a symbol of eternity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 448</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 8 sq.</bibl> Orell. ad loc.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 347</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 27; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 397.—</sense><sense id="n6636.1" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭtōlĭum Vĕtus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the Old Capitol</hi>, an earlier temple of Jupiter, Juno, and Minerva, on the Quirinal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=158" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 158</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, 713.—</sense><sense id="n6636.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6636.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The citadel</hi> of any town, e. g. in Capua, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 57</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in Beneventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 9</bibl></cit>; cf. also Plaut, Curc. 2, 2, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:267" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 267</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 68</bibl> (Veronae); 3314 (Faleriis); 6139 (Constantinae); 6978 sq.—</sense><sense id="n6636.4" n="B" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">any heathen temple</hi>, Prud. contr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:632" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 632</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capitulare: <entryFree id="n6637" type="main" key="ca^pi^tu^la_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtŭlāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prop. <pos>adj.</pos>, sc. vectigal; caput</etym>, <sense id="n6637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a head-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poll-tax</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3345</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capitularii: <entryFree id="n6638" type="main" key="ca^pi^tu^la_rii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtŭlārii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>capitulare</etym>, <sense id="n6638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tax-gatherers and revenue-officers</hi>, Cod. 12, 29, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6638.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Recruiting-officers</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 35, 3.</sense></entryFree>
capitularium: <entryFree id="n6639" type="gloss" key="ca^pi^tu^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtŭlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a capitation tax</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3345</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capitularius: <entryFree id="n6640" type="main" key="ca^pi^tu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>capitularii, II.</etym>, <sense id="n6640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to the recruiting of soldiers</hi>: functio, Cod. Th. 11, 16, 14.</sense></entryFree>
capitulatim: <entryFree id="n6641" type="main" key="ca^pi^tu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>caput</etym>, <sense id="n6641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by heads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summarily</hi> (rare; perh. only in the foll. exs.): dicere, Nep. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capitulatus: <entryFree id="n6642" type="main" key="ca^pi^tu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capitulum</etym>, <sense id="n6642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ending in a small head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">costae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capitulum: <entryFree id="n6643" type="main" key="ca^pi^tu^lum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpĭtŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caput</etym>. <sense id="n6643.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a small head</hi>, of man or beast: <cit><quote lang="la">operto capitulo bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.— Hence, in the lang. of comedy, for <hi rend="ital">a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 89</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and as a term of endearment: o capitulum lepidissimum,</quote> <trans><tr>most charming creature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6643.1" n="B" level="2"> Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">caepae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:77:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 77, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torcularii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 4 al.</bibl></cit> (perh. also ramulorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 113, § 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 5, 20, § 37</bibl>; cf. capitellum).—</sense><sense id="n6643.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6643.3" n="A" level="2"> In architecture. </sense><sense id="n6643.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The capital</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chapiter of a column</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:178 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 56, § 178 sq.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n6643.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The capital of a triglyph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6643.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The cross-beam of warlike engines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6643.7" n="B" level="2"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a covering for the head of females</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31, 3</bibl>; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 542, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6643.8" n="C" level="2"> Also late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a prominent part</hi> or <hi rend="ital">division of a writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chapter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">section</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 9, 19</bibl>; Hier. in Ezech. c. 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n6643.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A section of a law</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 37, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6643.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The raising of recruits</hi> (as an office), Cod. Th. 11, 16, 15.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6644" type="main" key="Ca^pi^tu^lum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭtŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Hernici in Latium</hi>, now perh. <hi rend="ital">Paliano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpĭtŭlen-ses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Capitulum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:8:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 8, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capitum: <entryFree id="n6645" type="greek" key="ca^pi_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpītum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">căpētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaphto/n</foreign>, <sense id="n6645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fodder for cattle</hi> (late Lat.), Aur. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 7</bibl>; Cod. Th. 7, 4, 7 and 13.</sense></entryFree>
capnias: <entryFree id="n6646" type="greek" key="capni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capnĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kapni/as</foreign>, smoky. <sense id="n6646.0" n="I" level="1"> (Sc. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>.) <hi rend="ital">A kind of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6646.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone of a smoky hue</hi>, of several varieties. </sense><sense id="n6646.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of jasper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl> (called, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 151</bibl>, capnitis = <foreign lang="greek">kapni/ths</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n6646.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of chrysolite;</hi> prob. our <hi rend="ital">smoky topaz</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 44, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capnion: <entryFree id="n6647" type="greek" key="capnion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capnion</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. capnos.</entryFree>
capnios: <entryFree id="n6648" type="greek" key="capni^o^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capnĭŏs</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/pnios</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">a)/mpelos</foreign>), <sense id="n6648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called from the dark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smoky color of the grapes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capnites: <entryFree id="n6649" type="greek" key="capni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. capnias, II. A.</entryFree>
capnitis: <entryFree id="n6650" type="greek" key="capni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kapni=tis</foreign>, smoky; <sense id="n6650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cadmia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 10, 22, § 101</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6650.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A smoke-colored precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capnos: <entryFree id="n6651" type="greek" key="capno^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capnŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kapno/s</foreign>, smoke; <sense id="n6651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> in pure Lat. pes gallinaceus, <hi rend="ital">fumitory</hi>, of several species, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:155 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 19, 98, § 155 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 36, § 57</bibl> (also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">capnĭon</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">kapni/on</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
capo: <entryFree id="n6652" type="greek" key="ca_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāpo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cāpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <cb n="CAPR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:9:3" default="NO">3, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 3</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/pwn</foreign>, <sense id="n6652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a capon</hi>, Varr. l. l.; Col. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:38" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cappadocia: <entryFree id="n6653" type="main" key="Cappa^do^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cappădŏcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kappadoki/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country of Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Taurus and Pontus</hi>, now called <hi rend="ital">Caramania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6653.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6653.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cappădox</orth>, <itype>ŏcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kappa/doc</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Cappaaocian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 6, 14</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:5" default="NO">3, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 39</bibl>; Gr. <case>acc.</case> Cappadŏcas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:77" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 77</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">appos. equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6653.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cappădŏcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cappadocia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cappadocian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:184" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:76" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:77" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:73 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 73 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:191" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 191</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:184" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 184</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Cappadoca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6653.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cappădŏcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cappadocian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the preced.: zizipha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 27, § 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6653.5" n="D" level="2"> CAPPADOCICVSEXERCITVS, upon a coin of Adrian, in Eckh. Doct. Num. 6, p. 493.—</sense><sense id="n6653.6" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cap-pădŏcarchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kappadokarxia</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the priest</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s office in Cappadocia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cappadox: <entryFree id="n6654" type="main" key="Cappa^dox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cappădox</orth>, <itype>ŏcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kappa/doc</foreign>. <sense id="n6654.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Cappadocia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which this province is said to have derived its name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6654.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Cappadocian;</hi> v. Cappadocia, II. A.</sense></entryFree>
cappara: <entryFree id="n6655" type="main" key="cappa^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cappăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> portulacca, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capparis: <entryFree id="n6656" type="greek" key="cappa^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cappăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> -im, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 90</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 79</bibl> P.; <case>acc.</case> -in, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:77" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 9</bibl>), and (rare) <orth extent="full" lang="la">cappă-ri</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/pparis</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">ka/ppari</foreign>, <sense id="n6656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the caper-bush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:54" default="NO">11, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 23, 44, § 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capparis cortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 17, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6656.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the caper-bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the caper</hi>, Plaut. l. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">capparin et cepas voras, Mart. l. l.: urinam movet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cappas: <entryFree id="n6657" type="gloss" key="cappas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cappas</orth>, <itype>marinos equos Graeci a flexu</itype> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ka/mptw</foreign> = to bend</etym> posteriorum partium appellant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=44" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 44</bibl> Müll.; v. hippocampus.</entryFree>
capra: <entryFree id="n6658" type="main" key="capra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caper</etym>, <sense id="n6658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a she-goat</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 79</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 62 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera = caprea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 152</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">A nickname for a man with bristly hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl>; cf. caper.—</sense><sense id="n6658.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6658.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A star in the constellation Auriga</hi> (which is Amalthea, transf to heaven), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 6</bibl>; Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 110.—</sense><sense id="n6658.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The odor of the armpits</hi> (cf. ala and caper), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6658.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cognomen of the</hi> Annii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6658.5" n="D" level="2"> Caprae Palus, <hi rend="ital">the place in Rome where Romulus disappeared in the Campus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where afterwards was the Circus Flaminius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:491" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 491</bibl>, Caprea Palus; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=49" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 49</bibl>, also called Capralia).</sense></entryFree>
capragenus: <entryFree id="n6659" type="main" key="capra_ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caprā-gĕnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">caprūg-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capra</etym>, <sense id="n6659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the flesh of the wild goat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caprago: <entryFree id="n6660" type="main" key="ca^pra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> cicer columbinum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caprarius: <entryFree id="n6661" type="main" key="ca^pra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capra</etym>, <sense id="n6661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the goat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutilago,</quote> <trans><tr>a species of tithymalus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 108</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căprārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a goatherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 10</bibl>, Col 3, 10, 17.— </sense><sense id="n6661.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caprāria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">f</hi> </sense><sense id="n6661.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An island near the south point of the Balearis Major</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Caborra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 643</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6661.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One of the</hi> Fortunatae Insulae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 702</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6661.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small island in the Tuscan Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the northern point of Corsica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in wild goats</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*ai)/gilon</foreign>), now <hi rend="ital">Capraja</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> 1, 439</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 644</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caprāsia</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 3</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caprārĭensis</orth>, e: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 49, § 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caprasia: <entryFree id="n6662" type="main" key="Capra_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caprāsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n6662.0" n="I" level="1"> = Capraria, q. v. C.—</sense><sense id="n6662.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the mouths of the Po</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caprea: <entryFree id="n6663" type="main" key="ca^pre^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>capra</etym>, <sense id="n6663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wild she-goat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a roe</hi>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=101" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 101</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 53, 79, § 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:124" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 45, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 374</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 725</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:372" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 372</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:99" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 99</bibl>; on account of the hostility between <cb n="CAPR" /> it and the wolf, prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">jungere capreas inpis, of something impossible,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6663.1" n="II" level="1"> Capreá Palus, v. capra, II. D.</sense></entryFree>
capreae: <entryFree id="n6664" type="main" key="Capre^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caprĕae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Tyrrhene Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 735</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 709</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:541" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 541</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">celebrated as the dwelling-place of the emperor Tiberius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2</bibl>; 6, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">60</bibl>; 62; 74; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:93" default="NO">10, 93</bibl>; who was thence, and in derision of his wantonness, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caprinēus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ca-prĕensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">secessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capreida: <entryFree id="n6665" type="hapax" key="ca^pre^i^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĕĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diuretic plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capreola: <entryFree id="n6666" type="gloss" key="ca^pre^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caprea</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">dorka/s</foreign>, <sense id="n6666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the roe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doe</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
capreolatim: <entryFree id="n6667" type="hapax" key="ca^pre^o^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĕŏlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>capreolus</etym>, <sense id="n6667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a winding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twining manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11</bibl>, p 268.</sense></entryFree>
capreolus: <entryFree id="n6668" type="main" key="ca^pre^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>as if from capreus, caprea</etym>. <sense id="n6668.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of wild goat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chamois</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roebuck</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6668.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, named from the form of their horns, </sense><sense id="n6668.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An implement with two prongs for cutting up weeds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weeding-hoe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6668.3" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">capreoli, in mechanics,</quote> <trans><tr>short pieces of timber inclining to each other</tr>, <tr>which support something</tr>, <tr>supports</tr>, <tr>props</tr>, <tr>stays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 15</bibl>; 10, 20; 10, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6668.4" n="C" level="2"> Of vines, <hi rend="ital">the small tendrils which support the branches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:31:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 31, 4</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capricornus: <entryFree id="n6669" type="main" key="Ca^pri^cornus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căprĭcornus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caper-cornu; cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ai\gokereu/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n6669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Capricorn</hi> (having a goat's horns), <hi rend="ital">the sign of the zodiac which the sun enters at the winter solstice</hi> (opp. Cancer), Varr 2, 1, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 59</bibl> (293); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:651" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 651</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:64 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 64 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 196" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 196</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caprificatio: <entryFree id="n6670" type="main" key="ca^pri^fi_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĭfīcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caprifico</etym>, <sense id="n6670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ripening of figs by the stinging of the gallinsect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 19, 21, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:254" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 27, 43, § 254</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caprifico: <entryFree id="n6671" type="main" key="ca^pri^fi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĭfīco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caprificus</etym>, <sense id="n6671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ripen figs by the stinging of the gall-insect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caprificus: <entryFree id="n6672" type="main" key="ca^pri^fi_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĭ-fīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caper-ficus, goatfig</etym>, <sense id="n6672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild fig-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi ubi etiam caprificus magna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 76; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 40, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 13, 35, § 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:2:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 2, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a play upon the word with caper and ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:52:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 52, 2</bibl></cit>. The gall-insect, Cynips psenes, Linn., springing from this tree, ripens by its sting the fruit of the cultivated fig-tree, ficus (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 44, § 256</bibl>, caprifico and caprificatio); hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, in allusion to the fact that the wild fig-tree strikes root in the cracks of stones, etc., and breaks them, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:25" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6672.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the wild fig-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wild fig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:56" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 15, 15, § 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprificus vocatur e silvestri genere ficus numquam maturescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 19, 21, § 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caprigenus: <entryFree id="n6673" type="main" key="ca^pri^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caper-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n6673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proceeding from a goat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the goat kind</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): genus, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl>; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 677</bibl> P.: pecu, Cic. Progn. Fragm. ap. Prisc. l. l.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĭgĕni</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">goats</hi>, = capri, ae: <cit><quote lang="la">caprigenum ( = caprigenorum or -arum) trita ungulis, Att. ap. Macr. S. l. l. (Trag. Rel. v. 544 Rib.): caprigenum pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 221</bibl></cit>; cf. Prisc. l. l. —To the sickliness of the goat (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 202</bibl>) Plautus refers humorously, Ep. 1, 1, 16.</sense></entryFree>
caprile: <entryFree id="n6674" type="main" key="ca^pri_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>caper, like equile, ovile, bubile, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n6674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enclosure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stall for goats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 42, § 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căprīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the goat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen, i. e. capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caprilius: <entryFree id="n6675" type="main" key="Ca^pri_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căprīlĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caprimulgus: <entryFree id="n6676" type="main" key="ca^pri^mulgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĭmulgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caper-mulgeo</etym>. * <sense id="n6676.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A milker of goats</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">countryman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6676.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bird supposed to suck the udders of goats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the goat-sucker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 40, 56, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caprineus: <entryFree id="n6677" type="main" key="Caprine_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caprinēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Capreae.</entryFree>
caprinus: <entryFree id="n6678" type="main" key="ca^pri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caper</etym>, <sense id="n6678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to goats</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:10:3" default="NO">2, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <pb n="288" /> <cb n="CAPT" /> pecus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:7:1" default="NO">7, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:38:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 38, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:99" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 30, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 68, § 232</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">rixari de lanā caprinā,</quote> <trans><tr>to contend about trifles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6678.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">că-prīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caro), <hi rend="ital">goat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s flesh</hi>, Val. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
